This patch removes the hard-code permission checks for db call
reservation_expire.

reservation_expire is only invoked in SchedulerManager. So there isn't
any REST API invoke it. So we can remove the hard-code permission directly.

commit_message:
Remove db layer hard-code permission checks for reservation_expire

This patch removes the hard-code permission checks for db call
reservation_expire.

reservation_expire is only invoked in SchedulerManager. So there isn't
any REST API invoke it. So we can remove the hard-code permission directly.

Partially implements bp nova-api-policy-final-part

Change-Id: Ic872d5d03fb0859a738e4cf2691c94b3963eb0b7

commit_message:
Set vpn agent's agent_state['binary'] attribute

No vpn agent related information is shown when running
agent-list cmd, although it's enabled. Set vpn agent
binary attribute to remind admin user that the vpn agent
is active not the l3 agent.

Change-Id: I7fa58f9a5a94f7fe4381c994ae425154a2a1c1d8
Closes-Bug: #1472494

subject: Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-07-14 06:25:24.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/tests/unit/db/v2/test_sqlite_transactions.py', 'mistral/hacking/__init__.py', 'mistral/hacking/checks.py', 'tox.ini', 'mistral/tests/config.py'], 'message': "Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names, and adds a hacking
check to prevent regressions.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: I7137e7199f1cd6cdeacbc6c421d294f596e2ec0e
"}]
commit_message:
Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names, and adds a hacking
check to prevent regressions.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: I7137e7199f1cd6cdeacbc6c421d294f596e2ec0e

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-13 19:32:20.000000000', 'files': ['meta/io.murano/Classes/resources/Instance.yaml'], 'message': "Use Custom networks as primary if no others exist

Modify the logic of primary network detection, so if the instance does
not join environment's default of flat networks, but some custom
networks are passed, the first of them is used as a primary one.

This fixes the issue when the floating ip address could not be assigned

Change-Id: Ief8819fd24695aceb118862839301b8045c41ea4
Closes-bug: #1474092

commit_message:
Use Custom networks as primary if no others exist

Modify the logic of primary network detection, so if the instance does
not join environment's default of flat networks, but some custom
networks are passed, the first of them is used as a primary one.

This fixes the issue when the floating ip address could not be assigned
in case of custom networking configuration.

Change-Id: Ief8819fd24695aceb118862839301b8045c41ea4
Closes-bug: #1474092

It might take a wile to kill worker after receiving of sighup because
of worker can be busy at the time, so the check of the workers count

commit_message:
Wait until child process will be killed

It might take a wile to kill worker after receiving of sighup because
of worker can be busy at the time, so the check of the workers count
can be failed during some amount of time.
Add timeout for checking.

Change-Id: Ibdd29b07960b2f765b03ea9458b6e85cd6786fd0
Closes-bug: #1472531

subject: Sort metric data before grouping and processing
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-13 12:11:19.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchi/ceilometer/dispatcher.py'], 'message': 'Sort metric data before grouping and processing

In gnocchi dispatcher, metric data will be grouped by resource_id and
counter_name before processing. But the inputted data is an unordered
list. It is better being sorted by resource_id and counter_name before
processing.

Change-Id: Id4f51adb60524a7b2bb08ef6cedd34f3d06f039a
'}]
commit_message:
Sort metric data before grouping and processing

In gnocchi dispatcher, metric data will be grouped by resource_id and
counter_name before processing. But the inputted data is an unordered
list. It is better being sorted by resource_id and counter_name before
processing.

Change-Id: Id4f51adb60524a7b2bb08ef6cedd34f3d06f039a

commit_message:
Add API schema for v2.1/v3 scheduler_hints extension

By defining the API schema, it is possible to separate the validation
code from the API method. The API method can be more simple.
In addition, a response of API validation error can be consistent for
the whole Nova API.

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: I7e54db52e55727f090128cc393a28043e1085636

commit_message:
fix possible symlink attack with ansible

The commands used to create a temporary file on the localhost were
vulnerable to a symlink attack. Removing the shell module and ensuring
the ansible copy and file module is used will verify this file exists as a
file with the correct permissions and ownership

Change-Id: I829483edf1435e41726ebfe1bc826e0c2e5265e3
Closes-Bug: 1471376

commit_message:
Arista ML2 driver should ignore non-vlan networks

Arista ML2 Mech driver for VLANs presently does
not filter out non-vlan type networks (e.g vxlan).
This fix will simply ignore the request if a
non-vlan based network request is seen.

This patch is a juno port for https://review.openstack.org/#/c/199380/8
The cherry-picking had to be done manually because of the decomposition
of the repository

Conflicts:
	neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/arista/mechanism_arista.py
	neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/arista/test_mechanism_arista.py

Change-Id: I99ec5c5772a9f1f63cf871a98be50bdd2ba5db62
Closes-Bug: 1472458

commit_message:
Remove self.snat_ports, a dvr thing, from router base class

This was overlooked in splitting out dvr code from the router base
class.  It is dvr only.  Also, it doesn't need to be an instance
variable and was not use consistently.

Change-Id: I0eff381c1613e3824c8da0f0ccba65dd3e884cbf

commit_message:
Use identity V3 API for endpoint creation

Always use the keystone V3 API when creating services and endpoints. The syntax
here is slightly different but we maintain the function interface.

Change-Id: Ib3a375918a45fd6e37d873a1a5c0c4b26bdbb5d8
Implements: bp keystonev3

The 1.1.0 release of mock library
exposed an issue in our tests and
the use of assert_any_calls.

For master we fixed up the tests, but
for stable, we want to just pin the
version.

Change is on its way through global req
process but hung up, trying to merge this
to get things moving again.

Change-Id: I74cc6600eb6049606c93613416962860745c6f35
'}]
commit_message:
Pin mock below 1.1.0

The 1.1.0 release of mock library
exposed an issue in our tests and
the use of assert_any_calls.

For master we fixed up the tests, but
for stable, we want to just pin the
version.

Change is on its way through global req
process but hung up, trying to merge this
to get things moving again.

Change-Id: I74cc6600eb6049606c93613416962860745c6f35

subject: Add future waiting helper module
revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2015-07-11 05:46:37.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'futurist/waiters.py', 'doc/source/api.rst', 'futurist/tests/test_waiters.py'], 'message': 'Add future waiting helper module

This code is useful for waiting on green or regular futures
and ensuring this is done in a safe manner (both kinds can
not be waited at on the same time, due to how the locking
and event objects & strategies of both differ).

Depends-On: Ie491d8a504903fb27dcb9610567e660b86669126

Change-Id: I44ae2d260c1ecbdbd45b00b26113f9f1d64db5b6
'}]
commit_message:
Add future waiting helper module

This code is useful for waiting on green or regular futures
and ensuring this is done in a safe manner (both kinds can
not be waited at on the same time, due to how the locking
and event objects & strategies of both differ).

Depends-On: Ie491d8a504903fb27dcb9610567e660b86669126

Change-Id: I44ae2d260c1ecbdbd45b00b26113f9f1d64db5b6

subject: Add oslo.serialization requirements
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-14 04:32:58.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Add oslo.serialization requirements

Without explicitly setting the oslo.serialization requirements,
version 1.7.0 will be downloaded and used for UT. However,
stable/kilo does not support this version of oslo.

Change-Id: I30bc7f76b8bef4ffc1049f9eb8f71c4b3962e192
Signed-off-by: Joe Mills <joe@midokura.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add oslo.serialization requirements

Without explicitly setting the oslo.serialization requirements,
version 1.7.0 will be downloaded and used for UT. However,
stable/kilo does not support this version of oslo.

Change-Id: I30bc7f76b8bef4ffc1049f9eb8f71c4b3962e192
Signed-off-by: Joe Mills <joe@midokura.com>

commit_message:
Arista ML2 driver should ignore non-vlan networks

Arista ML2 Mech driver for VLANs presently does
not filter out non-vlan type networks (e.g vxlan).
This fix will simply ignore the request if a
non-vlan based network request is seen.

Change-Id: I99ec5c5772a9f1f63cf871a98be50bdd2ba5db62
Closes-Bug: 1472458
(cherry picked from commit 581438a5b6dde5f161e1c129314a7bcaaae8da20)

commit_message:
Use ostestr for test runs

This commit switches to use ostestr for running tests. ostestr
integrates the subunit-trace output that other projects use for test
output. (in addition to some other ui niceties)

Change-Id: Ib5b5225b2a7bfb7897e1efe55181389d1ae095cb

commit_message:
Turn off oslo_conccurrency locking in volume driver

Since the volume driver is only accessed through one process, we
probably don't need concurrency locking.

Change-Id: I50f0cb4a7ef92a5fefe5fafb9f3ddadf0bf796b0
Closes-Bug: #1473535

commit_message:
Make `boot_runcommand_delete' accept command-dict

Make command-executing scenario `boot_runcommand_delete' accepting
command-specifying dict as input. Now `boot_runcommand_delete' is
able to execute a remote command, script from a local file
or inlined one.

Change-Id: I23308922ebae410b1682571c4f114c8080280b19
Implements: blueprint vm-workloads-framework

commit_message:
Change neutron command to validate token

Currently neutron_client.get_auth_info is being used just returns hash
of authentication. Changing command to list_networks to fix this

Closes-bug: #1442203
Change-Id: I98f275bc5a1275b2b83ec6b53f5f20b0bcc76ead

commit_message:
Fix iso-image-create to work on RedHat distros

- RedHat distros keep isolinux.bin at /usr/share/syslinux
- Do not use /usr/lib/syslinux blindly
Closes-Bug: #1472379

Change-Id: I2d58913090f2d35cc6446cf769b1f6618f29f849

subject: Fix TemplateSyntaxError at hypervisors view
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-13 23:27:11.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/hypervisors/tests.py'], 'message': "Fix TemplateSyntaxError at hypervisors view

If somehow nova API service-list isn't available, listing
hypervisors at /admin/hypervisors/ ends with TemplateSyntaxError.

Expected result is that the page should load but user will
see empty list and error message.

This fix is based on idea found in other views:

openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/...
images/views.py
aggregate/views.py
falvors/views.pu

that on any exception while getting data (get_data), we just
return empty list and handle exception to display error message.

Closes-Bug: #1392316

Change-Id: Ia665111185abecab6a96e6c72a6088cf2fa2e02b
(cherry picked from commit 5c4e827568be429ac5227a950c9f24c578ca8fd8)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix TemplateSyntaxError at hypervisors view

If somehow nova API service-list isn't available, listing
hypervisors at /admin/hypervisors/ ends with TemplateSyntaxError.

Expected result is that the page should load but user will
see empty list and error message.

This fix is based on idea found in other views:

openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/...
images/views.py
aggregate/views.py
falvors/views.pu

that on any exception while getting data (get_data), we just
return empty list and handle exception to display error message.

Closes-Bug: #1392316

Change-Id: Ia665111185abecab6a96e6c72a6088cf2fa2e02b
(cherry picked from commit 5c4e827568be429ac5227a950c9f24c578ca8fd8)

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-13 12:23:33.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/attributes.py', 'heat/tests/test_attributes.py'], 'message': 'Use __iter__ method of Attributes class in __repr__ method

Join method expects list, but six.itervalues(self._attributes)  returns
a Attribute instance, so we should use own __iter__ method for building
list of values.

Closes-Bug: #1473974

Change-Id: I7c5d4a5a8d0142156c3416347940b9e90ed8df5c
'}]
commit_message:
Use __iter__ method of Attributes class in __repr__ method

Join method expects list, but six.itervalues(self._attributes)  returns
a Attribute instance, so we should use own __iter__ method for building
list of values.

Closes-Bug: #1473974

commit_message:
JSCS Cleanup-style guide cleanup for filters.js

Use angular's isString function rather than using a typeof comparison.
Separate filter registrations from filter module declaration. Use $inject to
inject i18n dependency.

Change-Id: I269bc571119acfbe1f153109a63f77cd8c519873
Partially-Implements: blueprint jscs-cleanup

error handling code was trying to bring to the surface for operators.

If you run this test with nosetests --verbose --nocapture

... you can review most of the potential log output

subject: Properly decode body before calling json.loads()
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-07-10 20:45:53.000000000', 'files': ['tempest_lib/tests/services/identity/v3/test_token_client.py', 'tempest_lib/services/identity/v3/token_client.py', 'tempest_lib/common/rest_client.py', 'tempest_lib/tests/services/identity/v2/test_token_client.py', 'tempest_lib/services/identity/v2/token_client.py'], 'message': "Properly decode body before calling json.loads()

This commit fixes an issue when running the rest client and token
clients on python 3. httplib2 sets the type for the response body as
'bytes' when running on python 3, which requires that it be decoded
prior to running json.loads() on it. Additionally, in the v2 token
client a type check was done on the response body which was no longer
evaluating true because the type was no longer a 'str'. This was
fixed as part of the broader cleanup.

Change-Id: If4d496c4f10cec7d7050afc4b07f1f263de4c3e5
"}]
commit_message:
Properly decode body before calling json.loads()

This commit fixes an issue when running the rest client and token
clients on python 3. httplib2 sets the type for the response body as
'bytes' when running on python 3, which requires that it be decoded
prior to running json.loads() on it. Additionally, in the v2 token
client a type check was done on the response body which was no longer
evaluating true because the type was no longer a 'str'. This was
fixed as part of the broader cleanup.

Change-Id: If4d496c4f10cec7d7050afc4b07f1f263de4c3e5

subject: Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-13 21:12:49.000000000', 'files': ['tools/simulator.py', 'oslo_messaging/hacking/checks.py', 'oslo_messaging/hacking/__init__.py', 'oslo_messaging/_executors/impl_pooledexecutor.py', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names. It also adds a local
hacking check to prevent regressions, while disabling style checks in
the "tests" directory, which will be deleted in a subsequent patch.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: Iad2ae13c771c99861ca9493c6ab10edcfbd8684a
'}]
commit_message:
Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names. It also adds a local
hacking check to prevent regressions, while disabling style checks in
the "tests" directory, which will be deleted in a subsequent patch.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: Iad2ae13c771c99861ca9493c6ab10edcfbd8684a

revisions:

- pass the adopt data in next to the input_data
- since it is not stored in the db, assign the adopt data
  from the cache data in Resource.load()

  (just uncomment the raise NotSupported)

Change-Id: I3b3032602f18f86119c41a1bda29432e459c9966
'}]
commit_message:
convergence: add adopt support

- pass the adopt data in next to the input_data
- since it is not stored in the db, assign the adopt data
  from the cache data in Resource.load()
- in service.py make it easier to enable convergence
  (just uncomment the raise NotSupported)

Change-Id: I3b3032602f18f86119c41a1bda29432e459c9966

commit_message:
Fix unit test mocks for new mock release

The new mock release(1.1.0) broke some of the unit tests which
were using incorrect mock methods that do not really exist.

Before mock 1.1.0 using such incorrectly mocked methds would
silently pass -- but after the upgrade these (rightly) cause
errors that need to be fixed.

Change-Id: I35fbd142a199f5e5f39b7835fee0ac888dc9784b
Closes-Bug: 1473454

commit_message:
Change keystone command to openstack command

As noted in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/179650 , this file
still uses the old keystone command which has been deprecated
in favor of the openstack command.

This patch makes the switch, using
http://docs.openstack.org/cli-reference/content/openstackclient_commands.html
for reference.

Change-Id: I207b2d162dc0fca1266e0a895605665047d33a0d

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-26 06:53:21.000000000', 'files': ['etc/magnum/magnum.conf.sample', '.gitignore', 'etc/magnum/README-magnum.conf.txt'], 'message': 'stop tracking sample configuration file

All options in sample configuration file are actually default values.
It is unnecessary to track the sample file because user can generate it
automatically. As long as we track this file, it is our burden to ensure
this file is correct and updated, especially when it contains options of
oslo packages which are out of our control.

Change-Id: I26f70d47ed9786ffa5a298eb3e54169931d49cab
'}]
commit_message:
stop tracking sample configuration file

All options in sample configuration file are actually default values.
It is unnecessary to track the sample file because user can generate it
automatically. As long as we track this file, it is our burden to ensure
this file is correct and updated, especially when it contains options of
oslo packages which are out of our control.

Change-Id: I26f70d47ed9786ffa5a298eb3e54169931d49cab

[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-07-09 20:16:54.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/tests/unit/conductor/handlers/test_bay_conductor.py', 'magnum/conductor/template_definition.py', 'magnum/conductor/scale_manager.py', 'magnum/tests/unit/conductor/test_template_definition.py', 'magnum/conductor/handlers/bay_conductor.py', 'magnum/tests/unit/conductor/test_scale_manager.py'], 'message': "Implement bay smart scale down

We currently allow Magnum to scale down bays by removing nodes from
the Bay's ResourceGroup by updating the heat stack that created the bay.
The problem with this approach is that Heat decides which node to delete,
and all containers on that node will also be deleted. This patch make
the selection process smarter: we ask Heat to delete Bay node(s)
that have NO CONTAINERS on them.

Change-Id: Ic4d754dfe358dd8aad020bc3b80a4c9f3f1525fc
Implements: blueprint magnum-smart-bay-scale-down
"}]
commit_message:
Implement bay smart scale down

We currently allow Magnum to scale down bays by removing nodes from
the Bay's ResourceGroup by updating the heat stack that created the bay.
The problem with this approach is that Heat decides which node to delete,
and all containers on that node will also be deleted. This patch make
the selection process smarter: we ask Heat to delete Bay node(s)
that have NO CONTAINERS on them.

Change-Id: Ic4d754dfe358dd8aad020bc3b80a4c9f3f1525fc
Implements: blueprint magnum-smart-bay-scale-down

If a job is run on data sources that reference an hdfs host not
listed in the /etc/hosts file of cluster instances, the Oozie EDP
engine will update the /etc/hosts files accordingly.However, this
only works for hdfs URLs referenced via data sources. If for

URLs that reference an external hdfs, the Oozie EDP engineu will

Closes-bug: 1425731
'}]
commit_message:
[EDP][Oozie] external hdfs missed for URLs in job_configs

If a job is run on data sources that reference an hdfs host not
listed in the /etc/hosts file of cluster instances, the Oozie EDP
engine will update the /etc/hosts files accordingly.However, this
only works for hdfs URLs referenced via data sources. If for
example a Java job is run with manually specified input or output
URLs that reference an external hdfs, the Oozie EDP engineu will
not update the /etc/hosts files.

Change-Id: I42a89a347cdb1bd6cc9d8b8c2b03b8a09d2e17b9
Closes-bug: 1425731

commit_message:
DVR: cleanup stale floating ip namespaces

During l3 agent periodic resync NamespaceManager takes care
of cleaning up stale router namespaces. This is true
for qrouter- and snat- namespaces. However stale fip-
namespaces also need to be cleaned up.
The patch adds fip-ns handling to the NamespaceManager.

Closes-Bug: #1470909
Change-Id: Ib6a8ae2ff66c0e1dd0978838c3f274748898f73e

If somehow nova API service-list isn't available, listing
hypervisors at /admin/hypervisors/ ends with TemplateSyntaxError.

Expected result is that the page should load but user will
see empty list and error message.

This fix is based on idea found in other views:

openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/...
images/views.py
aggregate/views.py
falvors/views.pu

that on any exception while getting data (get_data), we just

"}]
commit_message:
Fix TemplateSyntaxError at hypervisors view

If somehow nova API service-list isn't available, listing
hypervisors at /admin/hypervisors/ ends with TemplateSyntaxError.

Expected result is that the page should load but user will
see empty list and error message.

This fix is based on idea found in other views:

openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/...
images/views.py
aggregate/views.py
falvors/views.pu

that on any exception while getting data (get_data), we just
return empty list and handle exception to display error message.

Closes-Bug: #1392316

Change-Id: Ia665111185abecab6a96e6c72a6088cf2fa2e02b

subject: Enhanced the email notification messages
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-07-13 21:06:33.000000000', 'files': ['monasca_notification/types/email_notifier.py'], 'message': 'Enhanced the email notification messages

Made the email notifications more clear with respect to the
host which caused the notification.  Added the target_host
if it is present in the subject and body of the message.

This allows an easier way to pinpoint the problem without
having to dig in to the alarm further.

BEFORE
------
Subject: ALARM "Host Alive Alarm" for Host: devstack

On host "devstack" thresholds were exceeded for the sub-alarms: max(host_alive_status) > 0.0 with the values: [1.0]

AFTER
-----
Subject: ALARM "Host Alive Alarm" for Host: devstack Target: 192.168.10.6

On host "devstack" for target "192.168.10.6" thresholds were exceeded for the sub-alarms: max(host_alive_status) > 0.0 with the values: [1.0]

Change-Id: Iac0e837b3d6899249a1dc2ea11d4f4017361ba23
'}]
commit_message:
Enhanced the email notification messages

Made the email notifications more clear with respect to the
host which caused the notification.  Added the target_host
if it is present in the subject and body of the message.

This allows an easier way to pinpoint the problem without
having to dig in to the alarm further.

BEFORE
------
Subject: ALARM "Host Alive Alarm" for Host: devstack

On host "devstack" thresholds were exceeded for the sub-alarms: max(host_alive_status) > 0.0 with the values: [1.0]

AFTER
-----
Subject: ALARM "Host Alive Alarm" for Host: devstack Target: 192.168.10.6

On host "devstack" for target "192.168.10.6" thresholds were exceeded for the sub-alarms: max(host_alive_status) > 0.0 with the values: [1.0]

Change-Id: Iac0e837b3d6899249a1dc2ea11d4f4017361ba23

commit_message:
define ODL_NAME unconditionally

ODL_NAME is used by not only stack, but also unstack.
So it needs to be defined for unstack to work.

Change-Id: If651ec9186ea4999932b3ba91a3b76e92cbf3a85
Signed-off-by: Isaku Yamahata <isaku.yamahata@intel.com>

commit_message:
StackResource convert operations to use RPC

Modifies create/update/delete to use an RPC call,
so it can potentially be handled by a different engine in a
scaled-out heat deployment with multiple heat-engine processes or
workers.

The current introspection interface via nested() is maintained, so we
minimize the impact on existing StackResource subclasses.  A future
optimisation would be to remove the DB polling from the
check_create_complete and instead rely on an RPC notification from the
engine handling the create when it's done.

Remove test_{create,update}_with_template_validates as this is
the normal behaviour of stack create/update.

Change-Id: I7b88a329ddb5df4005b0bc10810bc5e3cdd077ab
blueprint: decouple-nested
Co-Authored-by: Angus Salkeld <asalkeld@mirantis.com>
Co-Authored-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-02 15:42:19.000000000', 'files': ['elements/openjdk/element-deps', 'elements/openjdk/install.d/33-java', 'elements/openjdk/package-installs.yaml'], 'message': 'openjdk: revert to a semi-manual installation

Unfortunately, using package-installs means there is no way to set the
proper openjdk package depending on the version of the distro, and so
far it is hardcoded to 7. On Fedora >= 21, the default openjdk is 8, and
due to bugs in yum [1] this has not caused build errors so far, but
leaving a java-less image.

The chosen solution is to not use package-installs anymore, still using
pkg-map (called manually) to give the right name for the built distro.
The default is still set to install openjdk v7 everywhere, as before;
as drawback, building images based on Fedora >= 21 (which is the default
in diskimage-builder since version 0.1.43) will fail hard now.

[1] like not exiting when asking to install non-existing packages if
specified together with existing ones

Change-Id: I53195daa8d29b15dcae548eb76c5c9efb6ad50ef
'}]
commit_message:
openjdk: revert to a semi-manual installation

Unfortunately, using package-installs means there is no way to set the
proper openjdk package depending on the version of the distro, and so
far it is hardcoded to 7. On Fedora >= 21, the default openjdk is 8, and
due to bugs in yum [1] this has not caused build errors so far, but
leaving a java-less image.

The chosen solution is to not use package-installs anymore, still using
pkg-map (called manually) to give the right name for the built distro.
The default is still set to install openjdk v7 everywhere, as before;
as drawback, building images based on Fedora >= 21 (which is the default
in diskimage-builder since version 0.1.43) will fail hard now.

[1] like not exiting when asking to install non-existing packages if
specified together with existing ones

Change-Id: I53195daa8d29b15dcae548eb76c5c9efb6ad50ef

subject: Compound fields now coerce their elements' values
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-07-13 16:08:14.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_versionedobjects/fields.py', 'oslo_versionedobjects/tests/test_objects.py'], 'message': "Compound fields now coerce their elements' values

Added a special datastructures (CoercedList, CoercedDict and CoercedSet)
which are able to coerce their values to appropriate element type.
The instances of these structures are returned when the values of
appropriate compound fields initially coerced. As a result, all
subsequent calls which are going to add new elements to the fields'
collections will be processed by the overridden methods of new
datastructures, thus the new elements will be coerced and the exceptions
risen if the coercing is not possible.
This also fixes a bug in TestObjMakeList which was specifying incorrect
obj_name for the elements in 'objects' collection of MyList test class.
It was not leading to failures as the items of this collection were not
being coerced  prior to this patch.

This patch restores the functionality of patch
2da963c3b313e14c4e60301e87f9c9260d7166cb which was reverted due
to found bug. This one fixes this bug by removing custom initializers for
coerced collections.

Change-Id: I9dc8fc408cefea921e4e27c0e75f98291674f867
Partial-Bug: #1469865
"}]
commit_message:
Compound fields now coerce their elements' values

Added a special datastructures (CoercedList, CoercedDict and CoercedSet)
which are able to coerce their values to appropriate element type.
The instances of these structures are returned when the values of
appropriate compound fields initially coerced. As a result, all
subsequent calls which are going to add new elements to the fields'
collections will be processed by the overridden methods of new
datastructures, thus the new elements will be coerced and the exceptions
risen if the coercing is not possible.
This also fixes a bug in TestObjMakeList which was specifying incorrect
obj_name for the elements in 'objects' collection of MyList test class.
It was not leading to failures as the items of this collection were not
being coerced  prior to this patch.

This patch restores the functionality of patch
2da963c3b313e14c4e60301e87f9c9260d7166cb which was reverted due
to found bug. This one fixes this bug by removing custom initializers for
coerced collections.

Change-Id: I9dc8fc408cefea921e4e27c0e75f98291674f867
Partial-Bug: #1469865

commit_message:
Use DEPLOYWAIT while waiting for agent to write image

There is an assumption that anything in DEPLOYING state is locked; the
agent driver breaks that assumption. Fix it by using DEPLOYWAIT while
waiting for the agent to write an image.

Change-Id: I4957bd9608b1bc92177e69efef66ecb951181de1
Related-Bug: #1461937

commit_message:
Install more-specific ICMPv6 rule in DVR routers

The Openflow rule added in install_dvr_process_ipv6() is dropping
all ICMPv6 traffic, not just the Router Advertisement the comment
mentions. This is causing things like ping6 to fail to VMs on DVR
compute nodes because the reply packets are getting dropped in the
local DVR router before being sent to br-tun.

Change-Id: I14741dd4293e7cfb99cb6bba03cf583ca3ea82ef
Closes-bug: 1471000

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-07-13 16:25:34.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_assignment.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_v3.py'], 'message': "Centralizing build_role_assignment_* functions

Moving build_role_assignments_* functions from test_v3_assignment.py to
class AuthTestMixin in unit/test_v3.py

Currently, these build_role_assignment_* functions are only used inside
test_v3_assignment.py, but we need these common functionality to write
test cases in another module. So, it's better to place them in a common
place which can be referred by all test modules.

After putting these functions into AuthTestMixin, those test classes who
inherit from AuthTestMixin can directly using
self.build_role_assignment_* functions.

Change-Id: I9c7d78fab6c4f6428523c3fec7e9d9d305313ae3
"}]
commit_message:
Centralizing build_role_assignment_* functions

Moving build_role_assignments_* functions from test_v3_assignment.py to
class AuthTestMixin in unit/test_v3.py

Currently, these build_role_assignment_* functions are only used inside
test_v3_assignment.py, but we need these common functionality to write
test cases in another module. So, it's better to place them in a common
place which can be referred by all test modules.

After putting these functions into AuthTestMixin, those test classes who
inherit from AuthTestMixin can directly using
self.build_role_assignment_* functions.

subject: Raise the cap on oslo.config to <1.7.0
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-05-15 00:26:06.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': "Raise the cap on oslo.config to <1.7.0

oslo.config 1.6.0 has uncapped netaddr which is conflicting with capped
netaddr in other libraries released from stable/juno, like pycadf 0.6.2
which has netaddr capped based on what's in g-r stable/juno today.

FWIW, oslo.config 1.6.1 also has netaddr uncapped, so we really need a
1.6.2 release of oslo.config which has netaddr capped as of commit
6b4b23bdfea1bad2b86650a0c408e3365bc513ff.

A workaround for now is projects that require both oslo.config and
pycadf can move pycadf ahead of oslo.config in their install order.

This is impacting change Id18916953f6e1bae3688216eaf809c2086b4af13.

Change-Id: I478e539d6891db93b4886ed731945c1ade2c8f79
"}]
commit_message:
Raise the cap on oslo.config to <1.7.0

oslo.config 1.6.0 has uncapped netaddr which is conflicting with capped
netaddr in other libraries released from stable/juno, like pycadf 0.6.2
which has netaddr capped based on what's in g-r stable/juno today.

FWIW, oslo.config 1.6.1 also has netaddr uncapped, so we really need a
1.6.2 release of oslo.config which has netaddr capped as of commit
6b4b23bdfea1bad2b86650a0c408e3365bc513ff.

A workaround for now is projects that require both oslo.config and
pycadf can move pycadf ahead of oslo.config in their install order.

This is impacting change Id18916953f6e1bae3688216eaf809c2086b4af13.

Change-Id: I478e539d6891db93b4886ed731945c1ade2c8f79

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-06-29 14:09:59.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/l3/dvr_router.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/l3/test_agent.py', 'neutron/tests/functional/agent/test_l3_agent.py'], 'message': 'Fix FloatingIP Namespace creation in DVR for Late Binding

DVR has dependency on the portbinding host to determine
where to start the FloatingIP Namespace when floatingip
is configured. But when we assign a floatingip to a port
that is not bound, even though the API will succeed, the
FloatingIP Namespace will not be created by the Agent and
so the FloatingIP will not be functional.

This patch addresses the issue by creating the Namespace
and configuring the rules when the late binding happens.

The agent will be requesting the FIP agent gateway port,
if required and then proceed to configure the FloatingIP
Namespace.

Change-Id: I9b9158bddb626c2bb535acd709452560546fd184
Closes-Bug: #1447034
Closes-Bug: #1460408
(cherry picked from commit 0a82b8ae1951073ff5f9b096485b3acf1a541428)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix FloatingIP Namespace creation in DVR for Late Binding

DVR has dependency on the portbinding host to determine
where to start the FloatingIP Namespace when floatingip
is configured. But when we assign a floatingip to a port
that is not bound, even though the API will succeed, the
FloatingIP Namespace will not be created by the Agent and
so the FloatingIP will not be functional.

This patch addresses the issue by creating the Namespace
and configuring the rules when the late binding happens.

The agent will be requesting the FIP agent gateway port,
if required and then proceed to configure the FloatingIP
Namespace.

Change-Id: I9b9158bddb626c2bb535acd709452560546fd184
Closes-Bug: #1447034
Closes-Bug: #1460408
(cherry picked from commit 0a82b8ae1951073ff5f9b096485b3acf1a541428)

commit_message:
Use the 1.16.0 version of the oslo.messaging library

We cannot switch to the oslo.service in the murano[1] projects,
because the earlier version of the oslo.messaging library has
an error and the patch with bug fixing was merged in 1.16.0[2].

[1] I774c70bdf06b304f7d958eac488dc28b7625fb12
[2] I4159450f54609c5185146472179d4299fe0c9d30

Change-Id: Ifa7a03b21aaf6911039c465696a0476e97905793

(cherry picked from commit 1d9fd2aec00cb85034e5a23cc1beac33c74e0110)

commit_message:
Randomize tunnel id query to avoid contention

When networks are created rapidly, neutron-servers compete
for segmentation ids which creates too much contention and
may lead to inability to choose available id in hardcoded amount
of attempts (11)
Randomize tunnel id selection so that condition is not hit.

(cherry picked from commit 1d9fd2aec00cb85034e5a23cc1beac33c74e0110)
Conflicts:
        neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/helpers.py

Related-Bug: #1382064
Closes-Bug: #1454434
Change-Id: I7068f90fe4927e6e693f8a62cb704213b2da2920

commit_message:
In Arista ML2 driver Reconfigure VLAN on VM migration

Whenever a VM moves from one compute node to the other, the VLAN on the old
switch interface was not removed and the VLAN was not being provisioned on the
new switch interface. With this patch, the VLANs are provisioned correctly.

Closes-Bug: #1471050
Change-Id: I658ef87ffd82119f41beda9ba019e29a62dc96ff
(cherry picked from commit e0abd3f1039f57cc825a844a33e8341534377d31)

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-10 08:59:08.000000000', 'files': ['examples/osc-lib.py'], 'message': "initialize auth_url in examples/osc-lib.py

In the same way openstackclient/shell.py:prepare_to_run_command does it,
add

   client_manager.auth_ref

in examples/osc-lib.py so that auth_url is initialized. Otherwise it
fails with:

   AuthorizationFailure: Authentication requires 'auth_url',
     which should be specified in 'HTTPClient'

Change-Id: I34f85aa17e96f206f2f66ab351c34dbfa4435a47
Closes-Bug: #1463535
"}]
commit_message:
initialize auth_url in examples/osc-lib.py

In the same way openstackclient/shell.py:prepare_to_run_command does it,
add

   client_manager.auth_ref

in examples/osc-lib.py so that auth_url is initialized. Otherwise it
fails with:

   AuthorizationFailure: Authentication requires 'auth_url',
     which should be specified in 'HTTPClient'

Change-Id: I34f85aa17e96f206f2f66ab351c34dbfa4435a47
Closes-Bug: #1463535

tests, because this cause AttributeError

Add a tox environment for bandit so it can be run as a gate job
eventually. As-is, there are no high severity issues detected in heat.

commit_message:
Add HostMapping object

This patch adds a HostMapping object for interacting with host_mapping table.
Just like the InstanceMapping object, the database operations are also embedded
within the object.

Change-Id: I461141460f3d178682b699d516c3c730c2539fe1
Implements: blueprint cells-host-mapping

commit_message:
Remove wait_for_volume_status from compute client

wait_for_volume_status of compute client just calls the one of waiters
module and the method is a wrapper.
So the method seems redundant and it doesn't fit as service clients.

This patch removes wait_for_volume_status from compute client and
replaces it with waiters' one.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

commit_message:
Separate server_groups_client from servers_client

As the qa-spec of consistent-service-method-names, we have decided
all service client modules will be separated into a single module
by each resource.
So this patch separates server_groups_client from servers_client.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: Iffd5b32f8d04edee6302605dc68e03b130939ade

Most arguments of resource id are "<resource name>_id" in compute
service clients, but some arguments are different.
This patch renames them to "<resource name>_id".

In addition this patch changes argument of fixed_ips_client also.
However, the argument name is not "<resource name>_id" because the
argument is ip address, not resource id.
The arguments of keypairs_client also are changed with this patch,
and new arguments are not "<resource name>_id" because a caller needs

'}]
commit_message:
Make the arguments of resource id consistent

Most arguments of resource id are "<resource name>_id" in compute
service clients, but some arguments are different.
This patch renames them to "<resource name>_id".

In addition this patch changes argument of fixed_ips_client also.
However, the argument name is not "<resource name>_id" because the
argument is ip address, not resource id.
The arguments of keypairs_client also are changed with this patch,
and new arguments are not "<resource name>_id" because a caller needs
to specify keypair name on these APIs instead of ID.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I90cc456c0c49c79884bf0eb41fa93a9c602c1ef6

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-06-19 20:22:39.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/common/controller.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_identity.py'], 'message': "Mask passwords in debug log on user password operations

When a user is created, they change their password, or admin
changes their password and debug logging is enabled, the value of

Closes-Bug: #1465922
"}]
commit_message:
Mask passwords in debug log on user password operations

When a user is created, they change their password, or admin
changes their password and debug logging is enabled, the value of
the user's password was logged. The value should be masked.

Change-Id: I07b7441378fb630f01204d6b656b218f6b94dd5a
Closes-Bug: #1465922

commit_message:
requirements: Move neutron-[fwaas,lbaas] requirement into tox.ini

This changes the way we require on the neutron-fwaas and neutron-lbaas
code for unit tests in anticipation of a future version of pbr breaking
the way we're doing it currently.

Change-Id: I7132ff5d22456e95650e064a5d91f0b5cab68594
Signed-off-by: Kyle Mestery <mestery@mestery.com>

commit_message:
Remove support for enabling file injection

File injection is disabled in nova meanwhile, and devstack core
reviewers think it shouldn't be configureable in devstack anymore.
This basically reverts https://review.openstack.org/#/c/70560/

Change-Id: Ia7dd407da00c0b1c9641865aea1f7b74533d7357

commit_message:
Sync DB when enabling FWAAS

The DB has not been synced and neutron is going to fail while
managing the firewall.

Change-Id: I3cb5080a2416e0d0109cf7328da57cd1f8bbef5c
Fixes: rhbz#1230199

To handle this situation, a new middleware was added. The purpose of the

commit_message:
New middleware to handle SSL termination proxies

The Neutron API doesn't behave properly if it is behind an SSL
termination proxy. If this is the case, the HTTP redirections and the
links returned in the REST response bodies are built using http protocol
instead of https.

To handle this situation, a new middleware was added. The purpose of the
SSLMiddleware is to update the wsgi.url_scheme environment variable of
the request with the value contained in an HTTP header that can be
configured in neutron.conf (by default: 'X-Forwarded-Proto')

DocImpact

Change-Id: I8d1cf1db9332bc2b3273c0c7515700cff8dc5bf2
Closes-Bug: #1423283

commit_message:
Fix test discovery for api and functional paths

The use of the builtin unittest test loader was silently dropping tests
that couldn't be imported.

This change also drops the retargetable path from discovery in the api
path due to a previously-masked configuration problem, and fixes an
invalid import in a functional testing fixture module.

Fullstack tests are also disabled temporarily pending a fix for #1446261.

Note:
- fullstack tests are not really working in Kilo, so it's fine to
  disable them for the branch.

Change-Id: Ie44e45c117bd864538e7919dfcf499091fde7752
Related-Bug: #1440834
Related-Bug: #1443480
Closes-Bug: #1446405
(cherry picked from commit 4000b18275112a0c9e3aa055fbaea634ac89a382)

commit_message:
NSX QoS ext: RXTX factor can be decimal

In Nova flavors it is ok to specify a decimal RXTX factor.
For this reason when applying QoS to a port Neutron should not
convert this factor to an integer value, but simply ensure
it's a valid float number and positive.

Cherry-picked from commit: 538a7bf3c73d968185590d81a9b3a6523190aeb4
Partial-Bug: #1463363

Change-Id: I983123ef7fd8f1b52b358aff3b579459fce63033

commit_message:
Use _is_this_snat_host and remove _get_gw_port_host

The _is_this_snat_host utility should be used consistently.  After
replacing a call to _get_gw_port_host with _is_this_snat_host,
_get_gw_port_host is left as just a simple helper method for
_is_this_snat_host.  The indirection is excessive and so they are
combined.

Change-Id: I880c5fdc9db9ba1304dba74a6e12f3df604793e5

Move more snat code to dvr class that does snat

A few methods were left in the wrong class when splitting up the dvr
classes.  This commit reduces the amount of dependency between the
two.

commit_message:
Add ability for GET path to see/select alternate fragment archives

WIP: incomplete, not all existing tests retrofitted to pass yet

Changes include:
- storage nodes reporting when they have >1 fragment archive
available
- GET path recognizing alternates, when to use them and building
up the getters accordingly
- associated test changes for existing code (and new code of
course

Change-Id: I4f2825708a8526f35003101d6d39dd7afbb229eb

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2015-07-13 03:20:49.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_l3.py', 'neutron/db/l3_db.py'], 'message': "Ensure floating IPs only use IPv4 addresses

Description:
Presently Neutron doesn't validate the address family of floating IP
addresses or the internal addresses they are associated with. It merely
associates the first IP of the floating IP's port with the first IP of
the internal port, unless a specified fixed IP is specified. This can
lead to incorrect or poorly defined behavior when IPv6 is present.

The existing L3 agent implementation only manages IPv4 NAT rules. While
IPv6 NAT and NAT protocol translation are possible, the existing
implementation does not support these configurations.

Presently a floating IP can be created on an IPv6 only external network
or associated with an IPv6 fixed IP, but the L3 agent is unable to bind
these configurations.

Implementation:
When creating and updating a floating IP, only consider IPv4 addresses
on both the floating IPs port and the internal port he floating IP is
associated with. Additionally disallow creating floating IPs on networks
without any IPv4 subnets, since these floating IPs could not be
allocated an IPv4 address.

DocImpact
APIImpact

Co-Authored-By: Bradley Jones <jones.bradley@me.com>
Change-Id: I79b28a304b38ecdafc17eddc41213df1c24ec202
Related-Bug: #1437855
Closes-Bug: #1323766
Closes-Bug: #1469322
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure floating IPs only use IPv4 addresses

Description:
Presently Neutron doesn't validate the address family of floating IP
addresses or the internal addresses they are associated with. It merely
associates the first IP of the floating IP's port with the first IP of
the internal port, unless a specified fixed IP is specified. This can
lead to incorrect or poorly defined behavior when IPv6 is present.

The existing L3 agent implementation only manages IPv4 NAT rules. While
IPv6 NAT and NAT protocol translation are possible, the existing
implementation does not support these configurations.

Presently a floating IP can be created on an IPv6 only external network
or associated with an IPv6 fixed IP, but the L3 agent is unable to bind
these configurations.

Implementation:
When creating and updating a floating IP, only consider IPv4 addresses
on both the floating IPs port and the internal port he floating IP is
associated with. Additionally disallow creating floating IPs on networks
without any IPv4 subnets, since these floating IPs could not be
allocated an IPv4 address.

DocImpact
APIImpact

Co-Authored-By: Bradley Jones <jones.bradley@me.com>
Change-Id: I79b28a304b38ecdafc17eddc41213df1c24ec202
Related-Bug: #1437855
Closes-Bug: #1323766
Closes-Bug: #1469322

commit_message:
Adding initial layout for project specs.

As git does not support commiting empty directories and
new specifications will be submitted many levels away from the
root I chose to copy the tempate.rst into each projects directory.

This is something we could remove in future if desired but
seemed like a sensible way to setup the structure for now.

Change-Id: I154fe85f7de1cfffeaf2b2eaea31e821129342a5

commit_message:
Arista ML2 driver should ignore non-vlan networks

Arista ML2 Mech driver for VLANs presently does
not filter out non-vlan type networks (e.g vxlan).
This fix will simply ignore the request if a
non-vlan based network request is seen.

Change-Id: I99ec5c5772a9f1f63cf871a98be50bdd2ba5db62
Closes-Bug: 1472458

commit_message:
Provide a full path top level to test discovery

OS_TOP_LEVEL environment variable allows for the tempest code
to be in a different tree compared to .testr.conf.
However test_discover does not work because relative path is
passed in as top level. Fixing that.

Change-Id: Ieee0704c4895381bc64234bb18e720df67187aad

commit_message:
add functional tests for identity v2

split test_identity.py into test_user.py, test_project, etc.
To make functional tests run repeatedly without raising
duplicated error, clean up resources before exiting each test case.

Change-Id: I8f31ccbd70f1cccdab8b3720aac179e2e399486d
Implements: blueprint identity-functional-tests

commit_message:
Add temporary Ansible keystone modules

Due to the licensing issues and the modules not existing in upstream
Ansible yet, I have written a simple module to fill the gaps.

This also uses Keystone v2.0 for all create of users, roles and
endpoints. The implementation of Keystone v3 must be discussed after the
new modules arrive.

Partially-Implements: blueprint ansible-service

Change-Id: I389edd56741360dd26fbbc0a982f365ca27ff446

revisions:
[{'number': 13, 'created': '2015-03-13 10:27:46.000000000', 'files': ['config.mk', 'packages/rpm/module_mock.mk', 'packages/rpm/module_mock_config.mk', 'packages/rpm/module_sandbox.mk', 'prepare-build-env.sh', 'packages/rpm/module.mk'], 'message': '[WIP] Implement rpm package building in mock env

1) Flags added to config.mk:
   * USE_MOCK?=0 - mock usage (disabled by default);
   * USE_MOCK_WITH_LOCAL_MIRROR?=0 - build local centos mirror
     otherwise use mirror defined in USE_MIRROR
     (external mirror is used by default);

Examples:
   USE_MOCK=1 USE_MOCK_WITH_LOCAL_MIRROR=1 make python-fuelclient
     * build:
        - local centos mirror;
        - python-fuelclient (using local centos mirror);
or
   USE_MOCK=1 USE_MIRROR=msk make python-fuelclient
     * build:
        - python-fuelclient (using msk mirror)

Related-bug: #1348599
Related-bug: #1427239

Change-Id: I1298af3eb8e1b1ad516ba0797f133097807759eb
'}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Implement rpm package building in mock env

1) Flags added to config.mk:
   * USE_MOCK?=0 - mock usage (disabled by default);
   * USE_MOCK_WITH_LOCAL_MIRROR?=0 - build local centos mirror
     otherwise use mirror defined in USE_MIRROR
     (external mirror is used by default);

Examples:
   USE_MOCK=1 USE_MOCK_WITH_LOCAL_MIRROR=1 make python-fuelclient
     * build:
        - local centos mirror;
        - python-fuelclient (using local centos mirror);
or
   USE_MOCK=1 USE_MIRROR=msk make python-fuelclient
     * build:
        - python-fuelclient (using msk mirror)

Related-bug: #1348599
Related-bug: #1427239

Change-Id: I1298af3eb8e1b1ad516ba0797f133097807759eb

subject: [WIP] Speed up packages building
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2015-03-30 14:19:25.000000000', 'files': ['config.mk', 'image/centos/module.mk', 'packages/rpm/module.mk', 'sandbox.mk'], 'message': '[WIP] Speed up packages building

1) Use external mirror in sandbox
   Define variable BUILD_PACKAGES_WITH_UPSTREAM
    BUILD_PACKAGES_WITH_UPSTREAM=1
     * do not build local mirror
     * use upstream mirrors while building
       both rpm and deb packages
2) work with sanboxes in tmpfs
   * tmpfs size is set to 768M, because,
    - sandbox_mean_size = 420Mb
    - sandbox_max_size  = 430Mb
   * tmpfs for centos img = 4096Mb

Change-Id: I3c290504fd6d80991dbce12969827f12f55a24c2
'}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Speed up packages building

1) Use external mirror in sandbox
   Define variable BUILD_PACKAGES_WITH_UPSTREAM
    BUILD_PACKAGES_WITH_UPSTREAM=1
     * do not build local mirror
     * use upstream mirrors while building
       both rpm and deb packages
2) work with sanboxes in tmpfs
   * tmpfs size is set to 768M, because,
    - sandbox_mean_size = 420Mb
    - sandbox_max_size  = 430Mb
   * tmpfs for centos img = 4096Mb

Change-Id: I3c290504fd6d80991dbce12969827f12f55a24c2

commit_message:
Show which aggregate a hypervisor is member of

This adds support for showing which host aggregates
a hypervisor is member of, if any.
It supports hypervisors with or without nova cells.

Closes-bug: #1470875
Change-Id: I0cfe4f15fa8f8ba0be3295b79cd438998893114c

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-07 19:01:25.000000000', 'files': ['.eslintrc'], 'message': 'Ignore the ng_on_watch error from eslint

Based on the discussion at
https://github.com/Gillespie59/eslint-plugin-angular/issues/114
it seems that the rule is only applicable when the watches are
assigned on the $rootScope.
This rule is also not a part of the JP style guide.

Change-Id: Ic8c218c7d46229a4a2e7d9dcd951433aedd9d1ca
Partially-Implements: blueprint jscs-cleanup
'}]
commit_message:
Ignore the ng_on_watch error from eslint

Based on the discussion at
https://github.com/Gillespie59/eslint-plugin-angular/issues/114
it seems that the rule is only applicable when the watches are
assigned on the $rootScope.
This rule is also not a part of the JP style guide.

Change-Id: Ic8c218c7d46229a4a2e7d9dcd951433aedd9d1ca
Partially-Implements: blueprint jscs-cleanup

commit_message:
Remove sudo from docker operations

* Adding "build" user (who runs make) to docker
  group in order to remove sudo operations with docker
* Remove sudo from docker commands
* Inform user about re-start terminal session for
  update group membership

Change-Id: I5c4a2b33893db02aea5dae1e235626a414a20d62
Related-bug: #1348599

Synchronizing session on delete leads to traces in neutron-server
logs when such binding is deleted concurrently.

Change-Id: I7a2c9a8a59ce313c7d242230eeb5da69986bfbd4

(cherry picked from commit 29dd67ff754eba3064549886c0906a83500d1879)

commit_message:
Avoid synchronizing session when deleting networkdhcpagentbinding

Synchronizing session on delete leads to traces in neutron-server
logs when such binding is deleted concurrently.
Also, catch and ignore ObjectDeletedError during iterating over
bindings, that is possible since the code is not within a transaction.

Change-Id: I7a2c9a8a59ce313c7d242230eeb5da69986bfbd4
Closes-Bug: #1424593
(cherry picked from commit 29dd67ff754eba3064549886c0906a83500d1879)

 - Ensure nodejs installation from chris-lea (out-of-the-box nodejs should

 - Fix lrzip periodical issue with infinite loop (removed -U option)
 - Ensure bc package is present (for building img file)
 - Old files saved for checking and comparison (draft) should be removed
   in future, while new files include mock: module_mock.mk, mock_config.mk

ToDo:
  - Need to finish with openstack createrepo as there is no access to internal Mirantis
    resources (repo: http://mirrors.msk.mirantis.net/centos/) from outside
  - We still have several places with sudo, because we are working with files
    which are belongs to root. We still have sudo in such processes as:

       * preparing ubuntu mirror;
       * in several make targets: img, clean

Additional information:
  - mock (1.1.33-1) is currently used in Ubuntu 14.04. But it has some bugs,
    so we are fixing them in prepare-build-env.sh (create mock user, and system folders)
  - we use three different mock environments (rpm, bootstrap, openstack),
    for each environment we need to define 3 configuration files, which can be customized:
    site-defaults.cfg, logging.ini, fuel-$(PRODUCT_VERSION)-$(CENTOS_ARCH).cfg
  - Optimization should be performed: mock optimization, reusing the same environments,
    do not clear cache after build, enable ccache, use tmpfs, check  “file” options for
    mock in order to pass files to chroot environment, etc (should be discussed)
  - New Ubuntu mirror ($SOURCE/mirror/ubuntu/createrepo_docker.mk) approach is used for
    preparing ubuntu packages. So some part of functionality was implemented in docker
    phase, so for now make process should follow: centos->docker->ubuntu. New helper
    script was created ($SOURCE/mirror/docker/files/prepare_fuel_ubuntu.sh) in oder
    to prepare docker base image fuel/ubuntu on some third server and publish this
    image (URL) just near fuel/centos and busybox.
    (Note: In order to activate this feature you need to make changes in
       $SOURCE/mirror/ubuntu/module.mk:
	   - include $(SOURCE_DIR)/mirror/ubuntu/createchroot.mk
	   + include $(SOURCE_DIR)/mirror/ubuntu/createchroot_docker.mk)
     You also need to put fuel-ubuntu docker image (prepared after prepare_fuel_ubuntu.sh)
     to $(LOCAL_MIRROR_DOCKER_BASEURL) BEFORE running make

Change-Id: I0fcaf9f78888467e24b6dc79e79c62c860b9f642
Related-bug: #1348599
"}]
commit_message:
Remove sudo from make process (Makefile)

Done:
  1. sudo was removed for docker operations, by adding user
     to docker group.
  2. RPM-packages prepared with mock ($SOURCE/packages/rpm)
  3. initramfs prepared with mock ($SOURCE/bootstrap)
  4. OpenStack packages build with
     mock ($SOURCE/packages/openstack/rpm)
  5. Ubuntu mirror prepared in docker environment ($SOURCE/mirror/ubuntu/)

Notes:
 - Ask user to re-login, in order to correctly process groups' membership
 - Fix issue (pinning) with multistrap version  (#1312654)
 - Fix npm global installation permission issue (#1337343)
 - Ensure nodejs installation from chris-lea (out-of-the-box nodejs should
   be also «ok», as it was mentioned https://review.openstack.org/#/c/117212/)
 - Fix lrzip periodical issue with infinite loop (removed -U option)
 - Ensure bc package is present (for building img file)
 - Old files saved for checking and comparison (draft) should be removed
   in future, while new files include mock: module_mock.mk, mock_config.mk

ToDo:
  - Need to finish with openstack createrepo as there is no access to internal Mirantis
    resources (repo: http://mirrors.msk.mirantis.net/centos/) from outside
  - We still have several places with sudo, because we are working with files
    which are belongs to root. We still have sudo in such processes as:
       * preparing initramfs;
       * preparing ubuntu mirror;
       * in several make targets: img, clean

Additional information:
  - mock (1.1.33-1) is currently used in Ubuntu 14.04. But it has some bugs,
    so we are fixing them in prepare-build-env.sh (create mock user, and system folders)
  - we use three different mock environments (rpm, bootstrap, openstack),
    for each environment we need to define 3 configuration files, which can be customized:
    site-defaults.cfg, logging.ini, fuel-$(PRODUCT_VERSION)-$(CENTOS_ARCH).cfg
  - Optimization should be performed: mock optimization, reusing the same environments,
    do not clear cache after build, enable ccache, use tmpfs, check  “file” options for
    mock in order to pass files to chroot environment, etc (should be discussed)
  - New Ubuntu mirror ($SOURCE/mirror/ubuntu/createrepo_docker.mk) approach is used for
    preparing ubuntu packages. So some part of functionality was implemented in docker
    phase, so for now make process should follow: centos->docker->ubuntu. New helper
    script was created ($SOURCE/mirror/docker/files/prepare_fuel_ubuntu.sh) in oder
    to prepare docker base image fuel/ubuntu on some third server and publish this
    image (URL) just near fuel/centos and busybox.
    (Note: In order to activate this feature you need to make changes in
       $SOURCE/mirror/ubuntu/module.mk:
	   - include $(SOURCE_DIR)/mirror/ubuntu/createchroot.mk
	   + include $(SOURCE_DIR)/mirror/ubuntu/createchroot_docker.mk)
     You also need to put fuel-ubuntu docker image (prepared after prepare_fuel_ubuntu.sh)
     to $(LOCAL_MIRROR_DOCKER_BASEURL) BEFORE running make

Change-Id: I0fcaf9f78888467e24b6dc79e79c62c860b9f642
Related-bug: #1348599

In the past ceilometer was generaly hosted at / and URL generation

at /foobar or /telemetry and for URL generation to still work. This
changeset adds tests to confirm prefixed requests can work and fixes
the small number of issues that were found.

Note that because the ceilometer api has the temerity to not set

mounting would show bugs.

Closes-Bug: #1468796
Change-Id: I6e5cf440bc3bd8ffb4cc5c86aa19225b3c5f87ed
"}]
commit_message:
Make ceilometer work correctly when hosted with a SCRIPT_NAME

In the past ceilometer was generaly hosted at / and URL generation
was relatively straightforward. It should also be possible to host
at /foobar or /telemetry and for URL generation to still work. This
changeset adds tests to confirm prefixed requests can work and fixes
the small number of issues that were found.

Note that because the ceilometer api has the temerity to not set
location headers, we can't test that those are working, because
there aren't any. In general that's the place where SCRIPT_NAME
mounting would show bugs.

But we can confirm that content-location headers are okay.

Closes-Bug: #1468796
Change-Id: I6e5cf440bc3bd8ffb4cc5c86aa19225b3c5f87ed

subject: WIP: Add reconnect_interval parameter to "ping" listener
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-04-14 17:10:22.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_db/options.py', 'oslo_db/sqlalchemy/session.py', 'oslo_db/tests/sqlalchemy/test_exc_filters.py'], 'message': 'WIP: Add reconnect_interval parameter to "ping" listener

We've observed a potential condition with Galera that when a
node goes offline and work switches over to a new node,
we can get autoincrement failures for the first half a second
of statement executions.   This option adds a short delay
before the initial reconnect to a server when the existing connection
is caught as having gone down.

Change-Id: I12cfcbb2ff1ebee93ab0115df6d7c3c04a964571
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: Add reconnect_interval parameter to "ping" listener

We've observed a potential condition with Galera that when a
node goes offline and work switches over to a new node,
we can get autoincrement failures for the first half a second
of statement executions.   This option adds a short delay
before the initial reconnect to a server when the existing connection
is caught as having gone down.

Change-Id: I12cfcbb2ff1ebee93ab0115df6d7c3c04a964571

commit_message:
Correct 'DESIGNATE_SQL_DEBUG' export behaviour

Currently when i export 'DESIGNATE_SQL_DEBUG' from terminal
to false like 'export DESIGNATE_SQL_DEBUG=false',  this setting
does not work properly. This patch fixes this behaviour.

commit_message:
Region handling

Rather than have a REGION global that's used implicitly by the
memoizer, the application should create the region itself.

Change-Id: I96e52709a9fce062ed08166e44e8961897181f9b

subject: [WIP] Certification
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-01-06 13:02:14.000000000', 'files': ['fuelweb_test/models/environment.py', 'certification/tests/__init__.py', 'certification/logging.yaml', 'certification/tests/base.py', 'certification/type_check.py', 'fuelweb_test/tests/test_simple.py', 'fuelweb_test/settings.py', 'certification/main.py', 'fuelweb_test/helpers/decorators.py', 'certification/__init__.py', 'certification/tools.py', 'certification/tests/ostf.py', 'certification/config.yaml', 'certification/clusters/simple.yaml', 'fuelweb_test/tests/base_test_case.py'], 'message': '[WIP] Certification

Certification script and tools:
 - environment creation from yaml config
 - cli script that deploys cluster, save yaml config, run tests
 - tools for managing clusters

Fuelweb_test changes:

Make tests able to run on existing fuel (without reverting it
    from snapshot)
 - new config options:
    CREATE_ENV - if true than virtual machines would be used
    ADMIN_NODE_IP, ADMIN_NODE_PASS, KEYSTONE_AUTH_CREDS -
        related to existing fuel installation

Using creatign clusters from yaml mechanism from certification:
 - new config option:
    CLUSTER_TEMPLATES_DIR - directory with templates
 - revert_snapshot, bootstrap_nodes moved to decorators
 - All tests that create clusters will use decorator with_cluster
   from certification tools. Thus we will remove code duplication in
   tests related to cluster creation.

Changes in EnvironmentModel:
 - moved ssh related methods to separate SSH class
 - changed get_admin_node_ip with getting it from config if using
   existing fuel installation

As certification tools use fuelclient added setting fuel location and
credentials to base_test_case before importing certification tools.

Added decorator skip_if to skip tests from base_test_case if using
existing intsallation

Modified test_simple with changes listed above

Partially implements: blueprint fuel-certification

Change-Id: Idf5eb5341968447acb5f7bf1ed62fbb38a5d8800
'}]
commit_message:
[WIP] Certification

Certification script and tools:
 - environment creation from yaml config
 - cli script that deploys cluster, save yaml config, run tests
 - tools for managing clusters

Fuelweb_test changes:

Make tests able to run on existing fuel (without reverting it
    from snapshot)
 - new config options:
    CREATE_ENV - if true than virtual machines would be used
    ADMIN_NODE_IP, ADMIN_NODE_PASS, KEYSTONE_AUTH_CREDS -
        related to existing fuel installation

Using creatign clusters from yaml mechanism from certification:
 - new config option:
    CLUSTER_TEMPLATES_DIR - directory with templates
 - revert_snapshot, bootstrap_nodes moved to decorators
 - All tests that create clusters will use decorator with_cluster
   from certification tools. Thus we will remove code duplication in
   tests related to cluster creation.

Changes in EnvironmentModel:
 - moved ssh related methods to separate SSH class
 - changed get_admin_node_ip with getting it from config if using
   existing fuel installation

As certification tools use fuelclient added setting fuel location and
credentials to base_test_case before importing certification tools.

Added decorator skip_if to skip tests from base_test_case if using
existing intsallation

Modified test_simple with changes listed above

Partially implements: blueprint fuel-certification

Change-Id: Idf5eb5341968447acb5f7bf1ed62fbb38a5d8800

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-13 12:39:03.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/functional/agent/test_ovs_flows.py'], 'message': 'Increase max attempts to 2 for pings on ARP tests

If the server under test is under heavy load, the requirement
of the very first ping passing may be too strict. This patch
increases the max attempts to 2 for the ARP spoofing tests to
give time for the OVS flow changes to take effect.

Change-Id: Ib70790da23861a8ed9c77f9c11aaf8fa41bf581c
Closes-Bug: #1443916
(cherry picked from commit 749886eb6b065a93dfad7fe7ed930cb77fe37b94)
'}]
commit_message:
Increase max attempts to 2 for pings on ARP tests

If the server under test is under heavy load, the requirement
of the very first ping passing may be too strict. This patch
increases the max attempts to 2 for the ARP spoofing tests to
give time for the OVS flow changes to take effect.

Change-Id: Ib70790da23861a8ed9c77f9c11aaf8fa41bf581c
Closes-Bug: #1443916
(cherry picked from commit 749886eb6b065a93dfad7fe7ed930cb77fe37b94)

commit_message:
Add support for RabbitMQ connection heartbeat

Kilo oslo.messaging added heartbeating support for RabbitMQ
connections.  This patch adds support for this in Puppet modules
by managing the oslo_messaging_rabbit/heartbeat_timeout_threshold
and oslo_messaging_rabbit/heartbeat_rate settings.

Closes-bug: 1467667

subject: Improve ubuntu mkrepo.sh output and exit on error
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-10-10 14:45:38.000000000', 'files': ['mirror/ubuntu/files/mkrepo.sh'], 'message': 'Improve ubuntu mkrepo.sh output and exit on error

Currently we do not break ISO build in case apt-get notices some
dependency problems while building packages download list. Which
may lead to a broken ISO.

So we just need to print exact error message and exit in case of
"apt-get --print-uris" failure.

Change-Id: I8a49b27681ecf1b82cbdb2f28aa9fc1d1f4909a8
'}]
commit_message:
Improve ubuntu mkrepo.sh output and exit on error

Currently we do not break ISO build in case apt-get notices some
dependency problems while building packages download list. Which
may lead to a broken ISO.

So we just need to print exact error message and exit in case of
"apt-get --print-uris" failure.

Change-Id: I8a49b27681ecf1b82cbdb2f28aa9fc1d1f4909a8

commit_message:
Fix project name error when creating project (Keystone v3)

When using Keystone v3 and trying to create a project, an error
'Project name is already in use' always occurs even if the project
name doesn't exist yet. This fixes the issue.

Co-Authored-By: Brian Tully <brian.tully@hp.com>

Closes-Bug: #1462011
Change-Id: I66b8a5e25f4610694379da73a3cf32ba1f7785ee

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-07-13 04:55:02.000000000', 'files': ['barbican/tests/common/test_utils.py', 'barbican/tests/plugin/test_kmip.py', 'barbican/tests/plugin/interface/test_certificate_manager.py', 'setup.py', 'barbican/tests/utils.py', 'barbican/tests/tasks/test_keystone_consumer.py'], 'message': "Fix unit test errors caused by new mock version

This patch corrects a few errors that is currently breaking the gate
checks.  The trigger of these errors is an upgrade to Mock, but the
root is subtle issues with how Mock was being used.  All of these
changes will work correctly with the old and new versions of Mock.

1) Fix missing attribute errors (calls to non existing assert checks)
2) Fix use of assert_has_calls() (parameter should be a list)
3) Don't assume name of Mock instance
4) Upgrade to use of newer PBR to address import errors
       (this change will be forthcoming from an infra-bot)

Co-authored-by: Kaitlin Farr <kaitlin.farr@jhuapl.edu>
Change-Id: Id4f46ae77bda5a89fb112a779c089542c3987e7b
"}]
commit_message:
Fix unit test errors caused by new mock version

This patch corrects a few errors that is currently breaking the gate
checks.  The trigger of these errors is an upgrade to Mock, but the
root is subtle issues with how Mock was being used.  All of these
changes will work correctly with the old and new versions of Mock.

1) Fix missing attribute errors (calls to non existing assert checks)
2) Fix use of assert_has_calls() (parameter should be a list)
3) Don't assume name of Mock instance
4) Upgrade to use of newer PBR to address import errors
       (this change will be forthcoming from an infra-bot)

Co-authored-by: Kaitlin Farr <kaitlin.farr@jhuapl.edu>
Change-Id: Id4f46ae77bda5a89fb112a779c089542c3987e7b

subject: Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-05 19:20:38.000000000', 'files': ['solumclient/openstack/common/log.py'], 'message': "Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: I892c0b64ff6bab666f1f23f5e7aeb2da088ea087
"}]
commit_message:
Drop use of 'oslo' namespace package

The Oslo libraries have moved all of their code out of the 'oslo'
namespace package into per-library packages. The namespace package was
retained during kilo for backwards compatibility, but will be removed by
the liberty-2 milestone. This change removes the use of the namespace
package, replacing it with the new package names.

The patches in the libraries will be put on hold until application
patches have landed, or L2, whichever comes first. At that point, new
versions of the libraries without namespace packages will be released as
a major version update.

Please merge this patch, or an equivalent, before L2 to avoid problems
with those library releases.

Blueprint: remove-namespace-packages
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo-incubator/+spec/remove-namespace-packages

Change-Id: I892c0b64ff6bab666f1f23f5e7aeb2da088ea087

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-06-25 13:36:30.000000000', 'files': ['murano/tests/unit/api/v1/test_catalog.py', 'etc/murano/policy.json', 'murano/api/v1/catalog.py'], 'message': "Unite upload and modify policies

In murano dashboard package upload wizard has two actions:
1 uploading file itself
2 modifying package params

From the user point of view it's one process, but 2 different
API calls are triggered.

This commit prevents such situation:

If I want to forbid package modifying by non-admin,
package will be uploaded from the first wizard step,
package parameters will be shown for modification,
but wizard can't be submitted. So user will think,
that he can't upload a package since wizard is not
finished successfully) But actually, package is uploaded.

Change-Id: Ibf2a05a02f369e0ffc921e03781a4fe38d9d8b9e
Closes-Bug: #1457868
"}]
commit_message:
Unite upload and modify policies

In murano dashboard package upload wizard has two actions:
1 uploading file itself
2 modifying package params

From the user point of view it's one process, but 2 different
API calls are triggered.

This commit prevents such situation:

If I want to forbid package modifying by non-admin,
package will be uploaded from the first wizard step,
package parameters will be shown for modification,
but wizard can't be submitted. So user will think,
that he can't upload a package since wizard is not
finished successfully) But actually, package is uploaded.

Change-Id: Ibf2a05a02f369e0ffc921e03781a4fe38d9d8b9e
Closes-Bug: #1457868

commit_message:
Validate maximum limit for integer

If you pass limit value above mysql INT type to
quota-class-update api, then it raises 500 internal
server error.

Passed max_value=db.MAX_INT to validate_integer()
method to get appropriate error.

Closes-Bug: #1463387
Change-Id: I1075a20ea0142db6c35f1124ba40b23ffef4c2f8

Also, expanded test_create() test to check all basic operations:
get_by_id, create, update, and delete.

To facilitate update() check, introduced a new field for objects called
fields_to_update that stores names of fields that are not expected to be

commit_message:
objects.base: fixed object.delete()

It was using wrong call to delete an object from a session.

Also, expanded test_create() test to check all basic operations:
get_by_id, create, update, and delete.

To facilitate update() check, introduced a new field for objects called
fields_to_update that stores names of fields that are not expected to be
updated in an object. This allows us to keep the above mentioned test
untangled from specific object type.

Also made get_by_id() behave correctly (returning None) if the object
does not exist.

Change-Id: I1aecb2e7c4d8cb8f239072d1cb9df3db29dcedde

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-06-05 15:54:58.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/extradhcpopt_db.py', 'neutron/extensions/extra_dhcp_opt.py', 'neutron/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/28b1c9210609_add_force_option_flag_to_dhcp_options.py', 'neutron/agent/linux/dhcp.py', 'neutron/db/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/HEAD'], 'message': "Add dhcp-option-force support to dnsmasq

In order to support petitboot in the same grounds as pxe on ironic
(Change: Ib9e954feea2cec38dd8328ada35005c0311c2a1b) there is a need of
dnsmasq's dhcp-option-force giving the ability to set some default
parameters to be sent on BOOTREPLY messages like 208-211 from rfc5071.

Dhcp-option-force are pretty much the same as the usual dhcp-option but
will be sent always, even if the client doesn't request it.

Closes-bug: #1462426

APIImpact

Change-Id: Iecb3e168a805fc5f3d59d894c3f0d9298505e872
"}]
commit_message:
Add dhcp-option-force support to dnsmasq

In order to support petitboot in the same grounds as pxe on ironic
(Change: Ib9e954feea2cec38dd8328ada35005c0311c2a1b) there is a need of
dnsmasq's dhcp-option-force giving the ability to set some default
parameters to be sent on BOOTREPLY messages like 208-211 from rfc5071.

Dhcp-option-force are pretty much the same as the usual dhcp-option but
will be sent always, even if the client doesn't request it.

Closes-bug: #1462426

APIImpact

Change-Id: Iecb3e168a805fc5f3d59d894c3f0d9298505e872

commit_message:
DO NOT MERGE: make deprecation warnings fatal

This is a patch to understand what's the scope of deprecation warnings
we currently invoke, and whether warnings module filters work fine with
testr (there are concerns about its thread safety, so let's see whether
we catch any non-neutron invoked issues).

Change-Id: Iaa001339c76645c3dc98ebf8e3780c888088cff9

commit_message:
Add notification flag (True / False) to extension_manager
process_update_port

Extension manager didn't return any value regarding notify of update
port. This means that changes in a port via the ml2 extension manager
were ignored.
This fix adds return value (if needed) from all extension drivers.

Closes-Bug:1427641

Change-Id: I352d06146517c9ce3a02615bc9c0ec3be4f7f857
