subject: Add option --only-mine for admin user to list resources only from own tenant
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-06-13 08:21:09.000000000', 'files': ['neutronclient/v2_0/client.py'], 'message': 'Add option --only-mine for admin user to list resources only from own tenant

This option provide filtering of listed resources for admin users. To ensure
backward compatibility with existing neutron client implementation this is
reverse option then for example in nova.
Neutron client by default will still list resources from all tenants without
this option given in CLI for user with admin priviliges

Change-Id: I633907a13f57a89f961e188c28a94e580dc4bb96
Related-Bug: 1250766
'}]
commit_message:
Add option --only-mine for admin user to list resources only from own tenant

This option provide filtering of listed resources for admin users. To ensure
backward compatibility with existing neutron client implementation this is
reverse option then for example in nova.
Neutron client by default will still list resources from all tenants without
this option given in CLI for user with admin priviliges

Change-Id: I633907a13f57a89f961e188c28a94e580dc4bb96
Related-Bug: 1250766

commit_message:
Remove python26-jobs from futurist

We no longer need to provide and gate on 2.6
support as the consuming projects have all dropped
there own 2.6 requirement so it is now safe to drop
this job as well.

when listing floating IPs, even though support for this flag was
reverted out of nova-api a long time ago because the API change did

commit_message:
Support --all-tenants in floatingips-list

Until very recently, python-novaclient supported an --all-tenants flag
when listing floating IPs, even though support for this flag was
reverted out of nova-api a long time ago because the API change did
not go through the proper design discussion. During this time, some
users have developed an expectation to be able to list all tenants's
floating IPs when in reality nova-api does not support it. This spec
is to reintroduce support in nova-api while going through the proper
design discussion.

APIImpact

Change-Id: I3837dfa2b9d45012282430b981b92f0dfb8cfc1c

commit_message:
Enable trusts by default

This patch changes use_trusts default to True. Trusts have been
implemented long ago and are a natural way of supporting long, time
consuming deployments, that might involve several interactions with
other OpenStack services.

Change-Id: I14ba44684fd90dcb428f69fb64915504325ce88b

subject: Libvirt: vNIC<->network identification
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-06-11 20:56:37.000000000', 'files': ['specs/liberty/approved/libvirt-vnic-network-identification.rst'], 'message': "Libvirt: vNIC<->network identification

An instance may have network interfaces connected to very different
networks.  When DHCP isn't used in favour of a different management
system, the latter needs a way to know which vNIC is connected to
which network so that it can configure the network interfaces
appropriately. If a guest agent is present and the various network
interfaces have unique MAC addresses, the Nova API can report the
interfaces's names as they appear inside the guest. If one or both of
those conditions are not met, Nova can't know for sure how devices are
named and ordered inside a guest, but the API can report a device
index indicating a best-effort attempt to know the order in which
vNICs are ordered inside the guest.

APIImpact

Change-Id: I6e7c26245ae6faf676cd9a4510ff470027edc4b0
"}]
commit_message:
Libvirt: vNIC<->network identification

An instance may have network interfaces connected to very different
networks.  When DHCP isn't used in favour of a different management
system, the latter needs a way to know which vNIC is connected to
which network so that it can configure the network interfaces
appropriately. If a guest agent is present and the various network
interfaces have unique MAC addresses, the Nova API can report the
interfaces's names as they appear inside the guest. If one or both of
those conditions are not met, Nova can't know for sure how devices are
named and ordered inside a guest, but the API can report a device
index indicating a best-effort attempt to know the order in which
vNICs are ordered inside the guest.

APIImpact

Change-Id: I6e7c26245ae6faf676cd9a4510ff470027edc4b0

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-07-10 15:47:17.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/db/sync.pp', 'spec/classes/neutron_db_sync_spec.rb', 'spec/classes/neutron_server_spec.rb', 'manifests/server.pp'], 'message': 'Creation of neutron::db::sync

In order to standardize the way dbsync are run across our modules,
we create a new class neutron::db::sync.
This class will be included if sync_db is enabled.

By making this transition the neutron::db::sync class
can be returned by the ENC.

A use case would be in an highly available environment with 3 galera

commit_message:
Creation of neutron::db::sync

In order to standardize the way dbsync are run across our modules,
we create a new class neutron::db::sync.
This class will be included if sync_db is enabled.

By making this transition the neutron::db::sync class
can be returned by the ENC.

A use case would be in an highly available environment with 3 galera
nodes, include neutron::server on every node with sync_db set to false
and have the ENC return ceilometer::db::sync just for one node.

Change-Id: I81e824e3e9e8f901b2a0084c7a5ec42c53781864

subject: Revert "Clean nodes stuck in DEPLOYING state when ir-cond restarts"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-08 14:06:56.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/tests/conductor/test_manager.py', 'ironic/conductor/manager.py'], 'message': 'Revert "Clean nodes stuck in DEPLOYING state when ir-cond restarts"

This reverts commit 3a9f55ca38906397ab957d6c32c7f75bad237da3.

This patch makes the broken assumption that any node in DEPLOYING should
be locked; however the agent driver leaves the nodes in DEPLOYING while
the ramdisk is writing images etc, and the node is not locked. Fixing
the agent driver to use DEPLOYWAIT is the right thing to do; however
let's revert this until we sort that out.

Change-Id: Id215e3be89803cee5b95f81f42055eb74c9f5f56
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Clean nodes stuck in DEPLOYING state when ir-cond restarts"

This reverts commit 3a9f55ca38906397ab957d6c32c7f75bad237da3.

This patch makes the broken assumption that any node in DEPLOYING should
be locked; however the agent driver leaves the nodes in DEPLOYING while
the ramdisk is writing images etc, and the node is not locked. Fixing
the agent driver to use DEPLOYWAIT is the right thing to do; however
let's revert this until we sort that out.

Change-Id: Id215e3be89803cee5b95f81f42055eb74c9f5f56

commit_message:
Add ability to override compute_driver

This change introduces a new compute_driver parameter
for all compute driver manifests. This will allow a user to override
the compute_driver config value by its own instead of forking or
monkey-patching the manifests.

It also changes the compute_driver config value of Ironic
for ironic.IronicDriver which also works and better fit
the config value style already used in the other manifests.

Common use case for this parameter is to allow the use of a local
or derivative version of a driver which adds features and/or bug fixes.

Closes-bug: #1472445
Change-Id: I4cd211b389303c22f4c2aa6db7592cc9861d4f40
(cherry picked from commit 7a7051ab4885e8a7aaed50f6e90dfcdedfb57773)

Spark jobs in Cloudera 5.3.0 and 5.4.0 plugins are now supported.
Required unit tests have been added. Merged with current
master HEAD.

Change-Id: Ic8fde97e424e45c6f31f7794749793b26c844915
Implements: blueprint spark-jobs-for-cdh-5-3-0

commit_message:
Resolve 500 error during simultaneously deletion

We need to render not found in case if some resource was deleted
to prevent to_wrapped_dict() execution. This patch do that job.

Change-Id: Ie179869bbf15965263cff62bb35740d825b6cabf
Closes-bug: 1463068

Also change how mongodb is installed, slightly, to insure that it is

Change-Id: Id6ecb21614f7091e522d99bcadd3b5e237dd6723
'}]
commit_message:
Namespace functions in devstack plugin

Otherwise there can be collisions with other plugins.

Also change how mongodb is installed, slightly, to insure that it is
actually running. Otherwise calls to drop database during the
cleanup function can fail because mongo is not actually there.

Change-Id: Id6ecb21614f7091e522d99bcadd3b5e237dd6723

commit_message:
api: relax validation for unversioned requests

Adds the spec that talks about relaxing the validation of any requests
sent to the /v2 endpoint, and ensuring the X-OpenStack-Nova-API-Version
header is always ignored by the endpoint, and never returned,
even when powered by v2.1 code

blueprint api-relax-validation

Change-Id: Ib741094594bbd7b94f9e3ac8de468034513c4733

commit_message:
Handle the postgresql md5password in specs

Current password in spec/classes/X_db_postgresql_spec.rb isn't generic,
and will cause spec to fails.
This patch aims to generate this value on the fly for the to be created
project.

Change-Id: I113e6143f4a714e079e79749b4034880e3bd1440

subject: Output internal API VIPs
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-08 13:03:55.000000000', 'files': ['overcloud-without-mergepy.yaml'], 'message': "Output internal API VIPs

Seeding of overcloud keystone endpoints is currently done via a script
that is external to the overcloud heat stack. Previously the script
didn't have a way to figure out what are the IP addresses that it should
use for internal service endpoints. This patch adds those IP addresses
into the stack outputs so that the script can properly configure
internal endpoints.

Change-Id: I9ae4fc4413a79d6b7e2dce1571fd7083c23348ca
"}]
commit_message:
Output internal API VIPs

Seeding of overcloud keystone endpoints is currently done via a script
that is external to the overcloud heat stack. Previously the script
didn't have a way to figure out what are the IP addresses that it should
use for internal service endpoints. This patch adds those IP addresses
into the stack outputs so that the script can properly configure
internal endpoints.

Change-Id: I9ae4fc4413a79d6b7e2dce1571fd7083c23348ca

subject: Fix scripts/run-upgrade.sh
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-10 15:36:28.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/run-upgrade.sh'], 'message': 'Fix scripts/run-upgrade.sh

Currently, scripts/run-upgrade.sh will not successfully upgrade a
deploy from juno->kilo.  This update does the following:

- copies etc/openstack_deploy/env.d/* to /etc/openstack_deploy/env.d
- uses ansible modules where possible rather than using the ansible
  shell module
- forces ansible command to return true where necessary (we introduce
  new ansible host groups in kilo and these groups do not yet have
  containers built which will cause the ansible command to fail)
- updates the python code to keep is_metal configurations between
  juno and kilo deployments (kilo defaults is_metal=true for
  cinder_volumes, which was not the default on juno)
- moves a closing if statement higher up in the script which was
  erroneously causing a bunch of code to be skipped

Change-Id: Ic99dcbc3f64b8dbfec6188a017a8bcda1c80e544
Closes-Bug: #1471190
Co-Authored-By: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit d339da31035f03e226e335be794c3ac114148430)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix scripts/run-upgrade.sh

Currently, scripts/run-upgrade.sh will not successfully upgrade a
deploy from juno->kilo.  This update does the following:

- copies etc/openstack_deploy/env.d/* to /etc/openstack_deploy/env.d
- uses ansible modules where possible rather than using the ansible
  shell module
- forces ansible command to return true where necessary (we introduce
  new ansible host groups in kilo and these groups do not yet have
  containers built which will cause the ansible command to fail)
- updates the python code to keep is_metal configurations between
  juno and kilo deployments (kilo defaults is_metal=true for
  cinder_volumes, which was not the default on juno)
- moves a closing if statement higher up in the script which was
  erroneously causing a bunch of code to be skipped

Change-Id: Ic99dcbc3f64b8dbfec6188a017a8bcda1c80e544
Closes-Bug: #1471190
Co-Authored-By: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit d339da31035f03e226e335be794c3ac114148430)

Currently every host, both containers and bare metal, has a crontab

means that there is the potential for a service interruption if, for
example, a cron job were to cause a service to restart.

This commit adds a new role which attempts to adjust the times defined
in the entries in the default /etc/crontab to reduce the overlap
between hosts.

Change-Id: I18bf0ac0c0610283a19c40c448ac8b6b4c8fd8f5
Closes-bug: #1424705

commit_message:
Add role system-crontab-coordination

Currently every host, both containers and bare metal, has a crontab
configured with the same values for minute, hour, day of week etc. This
means that there is the potential for a service interruption if, for
example, a cron job were to cause a service to restart.

This commit adds a new role which attempts to adjust the times defined
in the entries in the default /etc/crontab to reduce the overlap
between hosts.

Change-Id: I18bf0ac0c0610283a19c40c448ac8b6b4c8fd8f5
Closes-bug: #1424705

commit_message:
Remove test dependencies from requirements.txt

requirements.txt is a runtime dependency list. This causes mock and
fixtures to need to be installed to install nova. That's not where we
should be putting test requirements.

Related-Bug: #1473401
Closes-Bug: #1440350

Change-Id: I78ba82ca7500e407ec67db843d91c3c6e5bb2181

subject: Disable cleaning by default in bifrost
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-10 14:35:31.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/ironic-install/README.md', 'README.rst', 'playbooks/roles/ironic-install/defaults/main.yml'], 'message': "Disable cleaning by default in bifrost

Many initial users have encountered headaches with cleaning as it is
relatively unexpected that a deleted node suddenly becomes unusable
for a period of time while cleaning is running.

As such, we shall change the default and augment documentation to
better communicate cleaning and it's need.

Change-Id: I6a1642cbfd2ca601c5478f2868ec080a6124a3e3
"}]
commit_message:
Disable cleaning by default in bifrost

Many initial users have encountered headaches with cleaning as it is
relatively unexpected that a deleted node suddenly becomes unusable
for a period of time while cleaning is running.

As such, we shall change the default and augment documentation to
better communicate cleaning and it's need.

Change-Id: I6a1642cbfd2ca601c5478f2868ec080a6124a3e3

commit_message:
Add configurable option [cinder]/cross_az_attach

nova has the configuration option [cinder]/cross_az_attach with a
default of True. This option allows attaching between instances and
volumes in different availability zones.

This commit makes this option configurable in the nova.conf template
and uses a default of True.

Change-Id: Ia95f3d4447b026a8e93c74a8c65a63dcea89994f
Closes-bug: 1457140
(cherry picked from commit 92b0c769ebfbb6c62df752959eaadcef807408d7)

===

'assert_has_calls' that have changed behavior in the new version
(no longer accepts single calls).

commit_message:
Fix failures introduced by the new version of mock

===

'assert_has_calls' that have changed behavior in the new version
(no longer accepts single calls).

Calls to non-existent assert methods that did not exist and were
silently passing.

Use of autospec on a class with decorated functions.

Conflicts:
      neutron/tests/base.py

(cherry picked from commit 3a871a73b88f8b75d64c88271b6fc6cdd4b1cfc0)

===

Fix dhcp _test_sync_state_helper asserting calls wrong

It was using a non-existing method that did nothing and
that masked other problems with the tests that used it.
Changed to use assert_has_calls() and fixed the problems
that fell out.

(cherry picked from commit b85cfa96118d73ad87b150e488f295cbf9a2c140)

===

Closes-Bug: #1473369
Change-Id: I164a9af2a7f9ac0f0229ec3c5071f7a470445c98

commit_message:
neutron: remove deprecated allow_duplicate_networks config option

https://review.openstack.org/192888
commit b06867c581541ed325ddc5e5b5a2d53b1b0261ac
Author: Matt Riedemann <mriedem@us.ibm.com>
Date: Wed Jun 17 13:28:51 2015 -0700

    neutron: remove deprecated allow_duplicate_networks config option

    Commit 4306d9190f49e7fadf88669d18effedabc880d3b deprecated the
    allow_duplicate_networks config option in Kilo and marked it for removal
    in Liberty where the default behavior is to just allow duplicate
    networks.

    This simply removes the option and checks/tests around it being False.

    DocImpact: Removed neutron.allow_duplicate_networks config option. The
               behavior in Liberty is now to simply allow duplicate
               networks.

    Change-Id: Icb3510bcf0c30e11d0304a86ead91a43f37602ec

 remove "allow_duplicate_networks" option at document.

 20150710:
 recover common.pot file content.

backport: none

Change-Id: Ia462614c3571112602d9d09beb712d6023e6e0ba
Closes-Bug: #1466726

/etc/openstack_deploy/conf.d/ to replace the haproxy

While this isn't the ideal system of drop-in/remove

commit_message:
Move haproxy vars to defaults

This patch moves the haproxy vars to the role defaults,
allowing a deployer to user global_overrides in
/etc/openstack_deploy/conf.d/ to replace the haproxy
configuration with whatever is desired for the deployment.

While this isn't the ideal system of drop-in/remove
configurations it would seem to be a reasonable interim
solution which achieves the goal of being able to implement
alternative configurations.

Change-Id: If4c35a83f67fbe59c09909fc9e5b712b4d0062c2
Closes-Bug: #1464329

The keystone command is deprecated and should be not used in the
examples. The openstack command is the replacement.

The openstack command has handy options for extracting fields

The openstack command can use names when creating role

Change-Id: Ic118284183001d10322cf357314672c5d98856a3

commit_message:
Use openstack rather than keystone

The keystone command is deprecated and should be not used in the
examples. The openstack command is the replacement.

The openstack command has handy options for extracting fields
so some of the commands were simplified.

The openstack command can use names when creating role
assignments and since this is more user-friendly the examples
were changed to use names rather than IDs.

Change-Id: Ic118284183001d10322cf357314672c5d98856a3

commit_message:
Add restrictions for admin bond

* admin(pxe) interface bonding should
  not be enabled for old releases
* non-lacp bond modes should always be
  available for admin inteface bond
* lacp bond modes should be available
  only in experimental mode

Change-Id: If04cb0d4f260bca0d2e01bca375e622310ebd512
Implements: blueprint admin-network-on-bond

commit_message:
Specific changes into settings of nova

This change adds:
- Refactoring to support any settings for nova
- The ability to override the nova settings:
    vncproxy_protocol
    vncproxy_port
    force_config_drive
    default_availability_zone
    default_schedule_zone
    cinder_catalog_info
    remove_unused_original_minimum_age_seconds
    force_raw_images
    use_local (conductor)
    notification_driver
    notify_api_faults
    quota_instances
    quota_cores
    quota_volumes
    quota_gigabytes
    quota_floating_ips
    quota_metadata_items
    quota_max_injected_files
    quota_max_injected_file_content_bytes
    quota_injected_file_path_length
    quota_security_groups
    quota_key_pairs
    auth_protocol
    auth_version
    admin_tenant_name
    allow_resize_to_same_host
    cpu_allocation_ratio
    disk_allocation_ratio
    ram_allocation_ratio
    scheduler_host_subset_size
    scheduler_default_filters
    libvirt_vif_driver

Partial blueprint: detach-components-from-controllers
Co-Authored-By: Dmitry Kabanov <dkabanov@mirantis.com>

commit_message:
Fix YAML indentation

Without this patch, the new puppet task example was failing with the following
exception:

[root@fuel ~]# fuel rel --sync-deployment-tasks --dir /etc/puppet/2014.2.2-6.1
[...]
yaml.parser.ParserError: while parsing a block collection
  in "<string>", line 1, column 1:
    - id: my_task
    ^
expected <block end>, but found '?'
  in "<string>", line 2, column 1:
    type: puppet
[...]

Change-Id: Ib8c62112fc2b367e6ae7dfc55857e0825b7df0ce

ports which aren't in the 'Interfaces' table.

This fixes an issue where neutron-ovs-cleanup would
fail if any sort of OVS bond was on the bridge getting
cleaned up.  This is because bonds don't have the same
attributes as ports, and thus fail subsequent ovs-vsctl

Closes-bug: #1473179
"}]
commit_message:
get_vif_ports: ignore non-Interface ports

This patch updates get_vif_ports so that it skips
ports which aren't in the 'Interfaces' table.

This fixes an issue where neutron-ovs-cleanup would
fail if any sort of OVS bond was on the bridge getting
cleaned up.  This is because bonds don't have the same
attributes as ports, and thus fail subsequent ovs-vsctl
queries.

Change-Id: Ic9d30e5916122ce23c5dc8631fbb71115ae8a960
Closes-bug: #1473179

subject: IBP Made getting image metadata a separate method
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-04-12 18:31:00.000000000', 'files': ['fuel_agent/fuel_agent/tests/test_nailgun.py', 'fuel_agent/fuel_agent/manager.py', 'fuel_agent/fuel_agent/tests/test_manager.py', 'fuel_agent/fuel_agent/drivers/nailgun.py'], 'message': 'IBP Made getting image metadata a separate method

It is better to make fuel_agent as modular as possible.
It allows to combine methods into various scenarios.
For example, validating images might be optional and
it is better to put validation code into a separate
method. Besides, it is easier to test programs if they
are modular.

Change-Id: I72649fcaccd7d14181aa8c8f4a5ab9235c89852f
'}]
commit_message:
IBP Made getting image metadata a separate method

It is better to make fuel_agent as modular as possible.
It allows to combine methods into various scenarios.
For example, validating images might be optional and
it is better to put validation code into a separate
method. Besides, it is easier to test programs if they
are modular.

Change-Id: I72649fcaccd7d14181aa8c8f4a5ab9235c89852f

commit_message:
Re-factor neutron client for 'list' methods

Currently neutron client is written to auto generate
methods on fly. This is very difficult to debug and
make code very difficult to read.

As neutron client will be moved to lib, it will be better to
have its interfaces more readable and consistent with other
service clients.

This commit re-factor it for 'list_*' methods.

Change-Id: Ia9513edd0ed5c080bd988cdf3e44e67774c698f9

commit_message:
libvirt: update live snapshot to use Guest object

This commit updates the method _live_snapshot to make it
pass a Guest object and then use BlockDevice object
to deal with block device operations.

commit_message:
Purged unused and ambiguous parts.

The motivation for that is to bring in line make code with
fuel-main documentation. As far as fuel-main is going to
be promoted as a set of tools for Fuel hackers we need to
make it clear and get rid of proprietary terms.

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-07-09 23:05:23.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/tests/drivers/test_impl_rabbit.py', 'oslo_messaging/tests/functional/test_functional.py', 'oslo_messaging/tests/functional/utils.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_rabbit.py'], 'message': "Make heartbeat the default

When heartbeat was introduced, it couldn't be enabled by default because
it depended on a minimum kombu version that we couldn't bump to at the
end of the release.

Now that Liberty is open and the minimum required version has been
bumped, I'm enabling heartbeat by default. The threshold this patch uses
is `60` which is the one gotten from tests and other deployments. Lets
make sure this is a sande default before merging the patch.

Change-Id: I21c29c328ef9936e76a215ab15962b46247dadd9
"}]
commit_message:
Make heartbeat the default

When heartbeat was introduced, it couldn't be enabled by default because
it depended on a minimum kombu version that we couldn't bump to at the
end of the release.

Now that Liberty is open and the minimum required version has been
bumped, I'm enabling heartbeat by default. The threshold this patch uses
is `60` which is the one gotten from tests and other deployments. Lets
make sure this is a sande default before merging the patch.

Change-Id: I21c29c328ef9936e76a215ab15962b46247dadd9

subject: Don't reply when we known that client is gone
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 2813, 'name': 'Mehdi Abaakouk', 'email': 'sileht@sileht.net', 'username': 'sileht'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 6159, 'name': 'Flavio Percoco Premoli', 'display_name': 'flaper87', 'email': 'flavio.percoco@flyrlabs.com', 'username': 'flaper87'}, {'_account_id': 7491, 'name': 'Viktor Serhieiev', 'email': 'viktor.sergeyev@gmail.com', 'username': 'vsergeyev'}, {'_account_id': 8770, 'name': 'Ken Giusti', 'email': 'kgiusti@gmail.com', 'username': 'kgiusti'}, {'_account_id': 13290, 'name': 'Oleksii Zamiatin', 'email': 'ozamiatin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'ozamiatin'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-07-06 10:16:56.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_messaging/tests/drivers/test_impl_rabbit.py', 'requirements.txt', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/amqpdriver.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/amqp.py', 'oslo_messaging/_drivers/impl_rabbit.py'], 'message': "Don't reply when we known that client is gone

In case of a broker restart/failover a reply queue can be
unreachable for short period the IncomingMessage.send_reply
will block for 60 seconds in this case or until rabbit recovers.

But in case of the reply queue is unreachable because the
rpc client is really gone, we can have a ton of reply to send
waiting 60 seconds.
This leads to a starvation of connection of the pool
The rpc server take to much time to send reply, other rpc client will
raise TimeoutError because their don't receive their replies in time.

This changes introduces an object cache that stores already known gone
client to not wait 60 seconds and hold a connection of the pool
Keeping 200 last gone rpc client for 1 minute is enough
and doesn't hold to much memory.

This also don't raise anymore a frightening exception when we can't send reply
to the rpc client. But just logging a info about missing exchange and
a warning about unsend reply.

Closes-bug: #1460652

Change-Id: I928b30c9b5f9ee007532ff703e136640b0e8aaf4
"}]
commit_message:
Don't reply when we known that client is gone

In case of a broker restart/failover a reply queue can be
unreachable for short period the IncomingMessage.send_reply
will block for 60 seconds in this case or until rabbit recovers.

But in case of the reply queue is unreachable because the
rpc client is really gone, we can have a ton of reply to send
waiting 60 seconds.
This leads to a starvation of connection of the pool
The rpc server take to much time to send reply, other rpc client will
raise TimeoutError because their don't receive their replies in time.

This changes introduces an object cache that stores already known gone
client to not wait 60 seconds and hold a connection of the pool
Keeping 200 last gone rpc client for 1 minute is enough
and doesn't hold to much memory.

This also don't raise anymore a frightening exception when we can't send reply
to the rpc client. But just logging a info about missing exchange and
a warning about unsend reply.

Closes-bug: #1460652

Change-Id: I928b30c9b5f9ee007532ff703e136640b0e8aaf4

commit_message:
Remove outdated tox environments for SQLAlchemy 0.8

The global requirements require now SQLAlchemy 0.9.7 or newer,
so there is no choice to test in a SQLAlchemy 0.8 environment
anymore. Just remove the code related to that.

Move the creation of /run (or /var/run if the former does not exist) to

commit_message:
hadoop: consolidate /run creation

Move the creation of /run (or /var/run if the former does not exist) to
the firstboot script for both hadoop v1 and v2, instead of creating it
with firstboot for v1 and statically in build for v2.

This avoids the same code done in multiple places, and at different
stages.

Change-Id: I2f9461d5435f441814f17c4767958264dc438f6f

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-07-13 08:10:32.000000000', 'files': ['sahara/service/edp/resources/launch_command.py'], 'message': 'Modify launch_command to support global variables

We use launch_command script to run Spark and Storm jobs on the guest.
Sometimes like in case of the Spark Shell job for the proper job execution
we need to set environment parameters on the guest before running the job.
launch_command is using the subprocess module to run the command.
subprocess.Popen is already supporting environment variables through the
"env" parameter, so all we have to do is populate this variable if needed.

This patch proposes to use the same format to transfer environment variables
to the command we use when running a shell script:

FILE="a" DIR="b" test.sh

In this case launch_command will parse a command line, separate environment
variables FILE and DIR from the command and send them to Popen using the "env"
parameter.

Change-Id: If110f00e95f0479b12e2d26cc30e9cbe4513e361
'}]
commit_message:
Modify launch_command to support global variables

We use launch_command script to run Spark and Storm jobs on the guest.
Sometimes like in case of the Spark Shell job for the proper job execution
we need to set environment parameters on the guest before running the job.
launch_command is using the subprocess module to run the command.
subprocess.Popen is already supporting environment variables through the
"env" parameter, so all we have to do is populate this variable if needed.

This patch proposes to use the same format to transfer environment variables
to the command we use when running a shell script:

FILE="a" DIR="b" test.sh

In this case launch_command will parse a command line, separate environment
variables FILE and DIR from the command and send them to Popen using the "env"
parameter.

Change-Id: If110f00e95f0479b12e2d26cc30e9cbe4513e361

commit_message:
Enable all services to use Keystone 'insecurely'

This patch introduces an insecure flag for the Keystone internal
 and admin endpoints:

* keystone_service_adminuri_insecure
* keystone_service_internaluri_insecure

Both values default to false. If you have setup SSL endpoints
for Keystone using an untrusted certificate then you should
set the appropriate flag to true in your user_variables.

This patch is used to enable testing and development with
Keystone SSL endpoints without having to make use of SSL
certificates signed by a trusted, public CA.

The patch introduces a new optional argument (insecure) to the
keystone, glance and neutron Ansible libraries. This is a
boolean value which, when true, enables these libraries to
access Keystone endpoints 'insecurely'. When these libraries
are used in plays, the appropriate value is set automatically
as per the above conditions.

Implements: blueprint keystone-federation
Change-Id: Ia07e7e201f901042dd06a86efe5c6f6725e9ce13

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-07-10 22:33:37.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/agent/test_securitygroups_rpc.py'], 'message': "Enforce specific order for firewall.(un)filtered_ports and devices

Lots of tests in the file rely on specific order of devices and ports
with which they are iterated thru inside firewall implementation. This
is needed to match a regexp against iptables output generated by the
firewall driver.

In production code, those .(un)filtered_ports dictionaries are
unordered, and it would be not wise to enforce the order for them just
for the sake of those unit tests.

Instead, we 'patch' the agent firewall with ordered versions of dict for
those attributes.

Also enforce specific order for device_info dictionaries we pass into
firewall.

The failure was easily reproducible with PYTHONHASHSEED=111, and after
the fix, it's gone.

While at it, stop making assumptions about stable order of dict.values()
between multiple dictionaries with the same keys. It may actually work
for now, but it seems fragile. Overall simplified regex construction
code a bit, f.e. killing some dead or redundant code.

Closes-Bug: #1473413
Change-Id: I170087426bc961592b4c4923c64a5fea30d51c21
"}]
commit_message:
Enforce specific order for firewall.(un)filtered_ports and devices

Lots of tests in the file rely on specific order of devices and ports
with which they are iterated thru inside firewall implementation. This
is needed to match a regexp against iptables output generated by the
firewall driver.

In production code, those .(un)filtered_ports dictionaries are
unordered, and it would be not wise to enforce the order for them just
for the sake of those unit tests.

Instead, we 'patch' the agent firewall with ordered versions of dict for
those attributes.

Also enforce specific order for device_info dictionaries we pass into
firewall.

The failure was easily reproducible with PYTHONHASHSEED=111, and after
the fix, it's gone.

While at it, stop making assumptions about stable order of dict.values()
between multiple dictionaries with the same keys. It may actually work
for now, but it seems fragile. Overall simplified regex construction
code a bit, f.e. killing some dead or redundant code.

Closes-Bug: #1473413
Change-Id: I170087426bc961592b4c4923c64a5fea30d51c21

subject: Remove usage of assert_called_once in mocks
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-07-11 19:55:00.000000000', 'files': ['glance/tests/unit/async/flows/test_import.py', 'glance/tests/unit/async/test_taskflow_executor.py', 'glance/tests/unit/v2/test_tasks_resource.py'], 'message': "Remove usage of assert_called_once in mocks

This was never a real part of the mock api, but mock was happily mocking
it out and letting the tests pass. The new mock release made this
behaviour break, causing tests to fail on all patches. This patch
replaces instances of assert_called_once with an assert of the mock's
call_count.

Closes-Bug: #1473369
Co-Authored-By: Ian Cordasco <graffatcolmingov@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I12ff85a9480d8000b0de54939c3be71458162a40
"}]
commit_message:
Remove usage of assert_called_once in mocks

This was never a real part of the mock api, but mock was happily mocking
it out and letting the tests pass. The new mock release made this
behaviour break, causing tests to fail on all patches. This patch
replaces instances of assert_called_once with an assert of the mock's
call_count.

Closes-Bug: #1473369
Co-Authored-By: Ian Cordasco <graffatcolmingov@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I12ff85a9480d8000b0de54939c3be71458162a40

commit_message:
Refactor mDNS packet finalization

mDNS packet finalization, i.e. writing out the packet header and
adding TSIG was duplicated. Refactor this into a smaller reusable
method.

Change-Id: I3fffc2b259044866933987aaed4c407a7febdeba

subject: Allow configuration of MySQL max_connections setting
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-10 15:44:41.000000000', 'files': ['overcloud-without-mergepy.yaml', 'puppet/manifests/overcloud_controller.pp', 'controller.yaml', 'puppet/manifests/overcloud_controller_pacemaker.pp', 'puppet/controller-puppet.yaml'], 'message': 'Allow configuration of MySQL max_connections setting

The number of connections created to the database depends on the
number of running processes and this is a factor of both the nodes
count and the cores count. We make it configurable so it can be
increased when needed.

Change-Id: I41d511bde95d0942706bf7c28cd913498ea165fb
'}]
commit_message:
Allow configuration of MySQL max_connections setting

The number of connections created to the database depends on the
number of running processes and this is a factor of both the nodes
count and the cores count. We make it configurable so it can be
increased when needed.

Change-Id: I41d511bde95d0942706bf7c28cd913498ea165fb

improvement observed.

commit_message:
Prevent deleting dhcp port from the API

dhcp port is a internal port, it should not allowed be deleted
via API, this fix will add a check to prevent deleting dhcp port
via API, but it changes the API delete_port, so the Doc also need
to  change.

DocImpact

Closes-bug: #1469615
Closes-bug: #1279683

Change-Id: I3e5ac388eada66f0988316f303705207311ff9e9

commit_message:
Rename api unit test folder name

This is a preparation to split the openstack api v1 test cases. The
current test case file is too large for maintenance. This patch renames
the openstack folder to openstack_v1 so that in future we (hopefully)
don't have to move them around again.

Change-Id: Ie939e2d6022e688e02c5c946346b223e7b319136

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-07-10 02:53:59.000000000', 'files': ['run_tests.sh', 'tools/with_venv.sh', 'run_tempest.sh', 'openstack-common.conf', 'tools/install_venv_common.py', 'tools/install_venv.py'], 'message': "Sync venv scripts from oslo-incubator

Currently install_venv.py and with_venv.sh create virtual
environment in .venv directory and there is no way to specify
the virtual environment path explicitly.

This has been fixed in oslo-incubator.
This patch sync those virtual environment scripts from oslo-incubator.
Also make run_test.sh and run_tempest.sh scripts to use 'VENV' env variable.

Change-Id: I55311cff4dea1f6c5adaa2a6d51eeee2f6cc71ea
Closes-Bug: 1370086
"}]
commit_message:
Sync venv scripts from oslo-incubator

Currently install_venv.py and with_venv.sh create virtual
environment in .venv directory and there is no way to specify
the virtual environment path explicitly.

This has been fixed in oslo-incubator.
This patch sync those virtual environment scripts from oslo-incubator.
Also make run_test.sh and run_tempest.sh scripts to use 'VENV' env variable.

Change-Id: I55311cff4dea1f6c5adaa2a6d51eeee2f6cc71ea
Closes-Bug: 1370086

commit_message:
Add deploy_start requirement to HA tasks

When separating these tasks from controller role,
these tasks end up appearing before deploy_start,
breaking deployment workflow.

Also added cluster as dependency for both tasks
cluster-haproxy and openstack-haproxy.

blueprint bp/detach-components-from-controllers
Co-Authored-By: Matthew Mosesohn <mmosesohn@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: Ib957feb529c59e932f35b590d4493c80b9652430

commit_message:
Adapt synced swift module

- Add upstream patches:
  * rebalance improvements I6bb1a144d1a5189ca32d407c6a7497aa397fafc5
  * DLO support Ie209e494d7affd72c3fea3f2cc3459b91d7c6765
- Adapt our manifests for synced swift module
- Fix noop tests for swift
- Add some new noop tests to cover resource ordering

Partially implements: blueprint upgrade-openstack-puppet-modules

Change-Id: Ib8fd54ed71613ae88fd87da3d538967712a87357

subject: Always replace tasks block in deployment info
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8392, 'name': 'Aleksey Kasatkin', 'email': 'akasatkin@mirantis.com', 'username': 'aleksey'}, {'_account_id': 8749, 'name': 'Evgeniy L', 'email': 'eli@mirantis.com', 'username': 'evgeniyl'}, {'_account_id': 8907, 'name': 'Dmitry Shulyak', 'email': 'dshulyak@mirantis.com', 'username': 'dshulyak'}, {'_account_id': 8931, 'name': 'Artem Roma', 'email': 'aroma@mirantis.com', 'username': 'aateem'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10391, 'name': 'Ihor Kalnytskyi', 'email': 'ihor@kalnytskyi.com', 'username': 'ikalnitsky'}, {'_account_id': 11082, 'name': 'Kamil Sambor', 'email': 'ksambor@redhat.com', 'username': 'ksambor'}, {'_account_id': 12200, 'name': 'Sebastian Kalinowski', 'email': 'sebastian@kalinowski.eu', 'username': 'prmtl'}, {'_account_id': 13445, 'name': 'Przemyslaw Kaminski', 'email': 'pkaminski@mirantis.com', 'username': 'PK'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-07-08 18:54:49.000000000', 'files': ['nailgun/nailgun/orchestrator/deployment_serializers.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/integration/test_orchestrator_serializer.py'], 'message': 'Always replace tasks block in deployment info

tasks block will be always serialized, we will serialize
it for informational reasons, but we can not preserve this info
for 2 reasons:

1. old clusters will require tasks block to be compatible with astute
2. granular deployment api relied on tasks to skip/run subset

And there  is mechanism that supports changes of tasks by separate api,
so there is really no reasons to preserve tasks at all

implements blueprint granular-deployment-based-on-tasks

Closes-Bug: 1472722
Change-Id: I5f061dec699a0ff6bb7c259a1dba79faa2d51610
'}]
commit_message:
Always replace tasks block in deployment info

tasks block will be always serialized, we will serialize
it for informational reasons, but we can not preserve this info
for 2 reasons:

1. old clusters will require tasks block to be compatible with astute
2. granular deployment api relied on tasks to skip/run subset

And there  is mechanism that supports changes of tasks by separate api,
so there is really no reasons to preserve tasks at all

implements blueprint granular-deployment-based-on-tasks

Closes-Bug: 1472722
Change-Id: I5f061dec699a0ff6bb7c259a1dba79faa2d51610

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-13 04:31:38.000000000', 'files': ['senlin/engine/actions/base.py'], 'message': 'Use LOG.exception instead of LOG.error for debug

This patch changes a LOG call from LOG.error to LOG.exception so that
the developer/operator can check the detailed call stack.

Change-Id: I26ae7eb18c89eb76d4d155929e77d6a998c28b58
'}]
commit_message:
Use LOG.exception instead of LOG.error for debug

This patch changes a LOG call from LOG.error to LOG.exception so that
the developer/operator can check the detailed call stack.

subject: Add deprecated and only alias modules for the moved types
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-13 01:15:21.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/types/periodic.py', 'taskflow/types/futures.py'], 'message': 'Add deprecated and only alias modules for the moved types

Provide modules for the moved futurist types that only provide
aliases to the old classes/functions and emit a deprecation warning
when imported. This allows for users of those classes/functions to
get off that code in a way that will be easily do-able (without totally
breaking there code-bases, until we do that in the 2.0 release).

Change-Id: If25ac34b437e2a575fe89b98abccbc9a56326d53
'}]
commit_message:
Add deprecated and only alias modules for the moved types

Provide modules for the moved futurist types that only provide
aliases to the old classes/functions and emit a deprecation warning
when imported. This allows for users of those classes/functions to
get off that code in a way that will be easily do-able (without totally
breaking there code-bases, until we do that in the 2.0 release).

Change-Id: If25ac34b437e2a575fe89b98abccbc9a56326d53

This allows those who were using it to still continue using it
until 2.0 where it will be removed; this makes it possible for
those users to get off that code in a way that will be easily
do-able (without totally breaking there code-bases, until we do
that in the 2.0 release).

This also removes all internal usage of that stop watch class
so that the library itself will not reference it anymore.

Change-Id: If313d8e7b9bdc8741db2e2e1dfb381aa3260b971
'}]
commit_message:
Provide a deprecated alias for the now removed stop watch class

This allows those who were using it to still continue using it
until 2.0 where it will be removed; this makes it possible for
those users to get off that code in a way that will be easily
do-able (without totally breaking there code-bases, until we do
that in the 2.0 release).

This also removes all internal usage of that stop watch class
so that the library itself will not reference it anymore.

Change-Id: If313d8e7b9bdc8741db2e2e1dfb381aa3260b971

commit_message:
Rename 'perm' argument of profile_create method to 'permission'

This patch renamed 'perm' argument of profile_create method to
'permission' in both rpc_client and engine service modules to make
it conform with the naming of argument in both profile_update
method and profile API interface.

Change-Id: Ifbd1bf8f609b4e3ceea5be02144d287fe18230bf

commit_message:
Move services from projects, users, roles

Services documentation was in the "projects, users, and roles"
section, but there was already a service management section. Also,
the "projects, users, and roles" section was missing subsections
for the different resources.

The service management section was only missing some text for how
to delete a service.

Closes-Bug: #1446235
Change-Id: I5d9fe64e09b30e059aa384a00bcacb4e847dee79

commit_message:
Avoid overwriting parsed_args

I just notice this in the context of this review [1].  It seemed like an odd
pattern to me but I wasn't sure if it should be folded in to that patch because
of the reach of the change.  So, I thought I'd post it as a clean-up.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/194078/13/neutronclient/neutron/v2_0/subnet.py

Change-Id: Iaf53f595e6d50fc18a33258439b6ae5e476dfca9

subject: Port short_id to return unicode
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-07-09 07:15:50.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_short_id.py', 'heat/common/short_id.py', 'py3-testlist'], 'message': "Port short_id to return unicode

This will now use unichr instead of chr to convert
an integer to byte-string. Then these bytes are
encoded and decoded with 'latin-1' to comply with
the existing tests that assert against absolute values.

partial blueprint heat-python34-support

Change-Id: I5b9de1cea54889fa388993b9afa4b45f01fbec4a
"}]
commit_message:
Port short_id to return unicode

This will now use unichr instead of chr to convert
an integer to byte-string. Then these bytes are
encoded and decoded with 'latin-1' to comply with
the existing tests that assert against absolute values.

partial blueprint heat-python34-support

Change-Id: I5b9de1cea54889fa388993b9afa4b45f01fbec4a

only. Existing evaluator have to exclude those 'event' type alarms
from thier targets which will be evaluated periodically.

Change-Id: Iddcf1d007107b8dbf74ed93f543bc860dbacea07
"}]
commit_message:
Exclude event type from targets of alarm evaluator

The new evaluator service will be added to handle 'event' type alarms
only. Existing evaluator have to exclude those 'event' type alarms
from thier targets which will be evaluated periodically.

Implements: blueprint event-alarm-evaluator

Change-Id: Iddcf1d007107b8dbf74ed93f543bc860dbacea07

In api, session recreation log messages are at WARN level which
can confuse administrators. These messages indicate nothing
unusual and should be at debug level.  VIM error while checking

This patch fixes the log level of these messages.

commit_message:
Update log level of session related logs

In api, session recreation log messages are at WARN level which
can confuse administrators. These messages indicate nothing
unusual and should be at debug level.  VIM error while checking
active session within an expired session is also normal and
shouldn't raise a warning.

This patch fixes the log level of these messages.

Change-Id: Ia5f81c20890973888f90a99e87e71cd18e8dd24b

commit_message:
Add 'event' type and 'event_rule' to alarm API

This patch adds 'event' type to the alarm type list.

This patch also adds AlarmEventRule which has two attributes; 'event_type' and
'query'. 'event_type' indicate which type(s) of event to be evaluated for the
alarm. 'query' is a list of conditions combined by AND as the same as
AlarmThresholdRule.

APIImpact
Implements: blueprint event-alarm-evaluator

Change-Id: I4681bf6fa9f01a77122d02dd619753bbb0b982ea

commit_message:
Use monotonic library to avoid finding monotonic time function

That library already does this same/equivalent search and
ensures that a monotonically increasing time is made available
so we can just avoid looking around for it ourselves.

Depends-On: I0f07858e96ea3baf46f8a453e253b9ed29c7f7e2

Depends-On: I33bd2d9dff9cb7dc1a50177db7286b7317966784

Change-Id: Idd2109c8947d10cdbd62c53998ab2e31382e8633

revisions:
[{'number': 15, 'created': '2015-07-12 21:47:32.000000000', 'files': ['neutronclient/neutron/v2_0/subnet.py', 'neutronclient/tests/unit/test_cli20_subnet.py', 'neutronclient/neutron/v2_0/__init__.py'], 'message': 'Determine ip version during subnet create.

Currently, the default IP version for a subnet-create is IPv4.
This behavior is wrong when we use a IPv6 subnetpool and
do not specify the ip version explicitly during the subnet
create operation.

This fix proposes to make the neutron client code for subnet
creation become aware of the subnetpool version. This ensures
that the proper IP version is sent down to the neutron server
if the subnet create is requested with a subnetpool.

Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I13da0f204e8ce335a2082c7d829bee28ac567c3f
Closes-bug: 1444146
'}]
commit_message:
Determine ip version during subnet create.

Currently, the default IP version for a subnet-create is IPv4.
This behavior is wrong when we use a IPv6 subnetpool and
do not specify the ip version explicitly during the subnet
create operation.

This fix proposes to make the neutron client code for subnet
creation become aware of the subnetpool version. This ensures
that the proper IP version is sent down to the neutron server
if the subnet create is requested with a subnetpool.

Co-Authored-By: Akihiro Motoki <amotoki@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I13da0f204e8ce335a2082c7d829bee28ac567c3f
Closes-bug: 1444146

commit_message:
Add retries to Tintri driver API calls

If there is a failure while using the requests module, the Tintri driver
will now retry the default number of times.

Change-Id: Ia97b0b608162623fbf662330ff31a139214e2136

commit_message:
Move fixture dependencies to extras

Rather than always installing dependencies for the test tools included
in the library, define an extras called "test" and include the
dependencies there.

Add API documentation for the fixture module, and include notes about
installing the extra dependencies in the module documentation and
installation instructions.

Closes-Bug: #1440350

__init__.py is usually an empty file, or contains platform specific
code to make the package function. One more use is to have __init__.py
contain import statements, to import functions and classes, for convenience.

http://docs.python-guide.org/en/latest/writing/structure/#packages

'}]
commit_message:
Make IPAM more pythonic

__init__.py is usually an empty file, or contains platform specific
code to make the package function. One more use is to have __init__.py
contain import statements, to import functions and classes, for convenience.

http://docs.python-guide.org/en/latest/writing/structure/#packages
http://mikegrouchy.com/blog/2012/05/be-pythonic-__init__py.html

Change-Id: I7408ac95f4970fbd7009257dfb698102ffabb6e3

subject: Call UnsetStub/VerifyAll properly for tests with exceptions
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-07-12 19:59:00.000000000', 'files': ['neutronclient/tests/unit/test_cli20.py', 'neutronclient/tests/unit/test_cli20_subnet.py'], 'message': 'Call UnsetStub/VerifyAll properly for tests with exceptions

Some subnet tests expects CommandError before calling stubbed
API call. As a result, self.mox.VerifyAll and self.mox.UnsetStubs
in _test_create_resource are not called. It is because
_test_create_resource does not handle an exception from
shell.run_command. This commit changes _test_create_resource
to deal with an expected exception.

The current unit tests works, but it would be a problem for
future feature enhancement. This problem is found during
debugging unit test failure in the review of
I13da0f204e8ce335a2082c7d829bee28ac567c3f

Change-Id: Icb85156f6a2d8e9c0a45cea6e64672e8bf56f15c
'}]
commit_message:
Call UnsetStub/VerifyAll properly for tests with exceptions

Some subnet tests expects CommandError before calling stubbed
API call. As a result, self.mox.VerifyAll and self.mox.UnsetStubs
in _test_create_resource are not called. It is because
_test_create_resource does not handle an exception from
shell.run_command. This commit changes _test_create_resource
to deal with an expected exception.

The current unit tests works, but it would be a problem for
future feature enhancement. This problem is found during
debugging unit test failure in the review of
I13da0f204e8ce335a2082c7d829bee28ac567c3f

Change-Id: Icb85156f6a2d8e9c0a45cea6e64672e8bf56f15c

commit_message:
Fix misleading information about instance restore

The information about instance restore action in Nova v2.1 API ref
is misleading, the restore action is used to restore soft-deleted
instances, not deleted instances.

Change-Id: I2d8819855f2501f32b1970fba0d5b63dea74bb0f
Closes-Bug: #1472460

commit_message:
Change plugin docs to fix mislead about sla plugin

The previous document lead you to implement (the check() method) in creating sla plugin.
But we have to implement add_iteration(iteration),detail() method not check() method.
So I changed so that lead user to implement add_iteration(iteration),detail() method.

Change-Id: Ie64d573a10bd8d4f7ffcc61edb1d6f0a2baf2d9c
Closes-Bug: #1473642

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-06-19 07:33:30.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/api/contrib/quotas.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/api/contrib/test_volume_transfer.py', 'cinder/api/v2/volume_metadata.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/api/contrib/test_consistencygroups.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/api/contrib/test_volume_type_encryption.py', 'cinder/api/contrib/volume_type_encryption.py', 'cinder/api/contrib/cgsnapshots.py', 'cinder/api/contrib/qos_specs_manage.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/api/contrib/test_cgsnapshots.py', 'cinder/api/contrib/types_extra_specs.py', 'cinder/api/contrib/consistencygroups.py', 'cinder/api/v2/snapshot_metadata.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/api/contrib/test_backups.py', 'cinder/api/contrib/services.py', 'cinder/api/v2/volumes.py', 'cinder/api/contrib/backups.py', 'cinder/api/contrib/types_manage.py', 'cinder/api/contrib/volume_manage.py', 'cinder/api/contrib/volume_type_access.py', 'cinder/api/contrib/volume_transfer.py', 'cinder/api/v2/snapshots.py', 'cinder/api/openstack/wsgi.py'], 'message': 'Validate outermost request body element name consistently

1. Return useful error message instead of empty error message.
ex.- Return "Missing required element '<element name>' in request body"
     instead of "Bad Request"
2. Return consistent error message in case request body element
name is not present.
3. Added 'assert_valid_body' method to raise HTTPBadRequest exception
if request body is not valid. It is not possible to modify
'is_valid_body' method itself to raise exception because V1 and v2
api's return different error code when 'is_valid_body' returns False.

APIImpact

Closes-bug: #1461402
Change-Id: I81764cd8517484fbee4beae2b30668c8b180d677
'}]
commit_message:
Validate outermost request body element name consistently

1. Return useful error message instead of empty error message.
ex.- Return "Missing required element '<element name>' in request body"
     instead of "Bad Request"
2. Return consistent error message in case request body element
name is not present.
3. Added 'assert_valid_body' method to raise HTTPBadRequest exception
if request body is not valid. It is not possible to modify
'is_valid_body' method itself to raise exception because V1 and v2
api's return different error code when 'is_valid_body' returns False.

APIImpact

Closes-bug: #1461402
Change-Id: I81764cd8517484fbee4beae2b30668c8b180d677

crucially fixes Python 3.4 support allowing us to get rid of the six
hacks we've been using to use mock on 3.4.

funcsig comes into upper-constraints as a transitive dep, but as we
have no dep on it in our projects, its not added to

As we still have some 2.6 jobs around, I've pinned mock for 2.6 to

commit_message:
Make mock 1.1 the minimum version.

1.1 has numerous new features backported from cPython 3.5, and
crucially fixes Python 3.4 support allowing us to get rid of the six
hacks we've been using to use mock on 3.4.

funcsig comes into upper-constraints as a transitive dep, but as we
have no dep on it in our projects, its not added to
global-requirements.txt.

As we still have some 2.6 jobs around, I've pinned mock for 2.6 to
1.0.1, the last release of mock for 2.6.

Change-Id: Ibd2410e0153053b5121155474e99752256c7e4b8

commit_message:
Fix address parsing for server ssh command

There seem to be three formats for the server address field
and the old code only supported the old format.  This code adds
a parser for all three formats.

Change-Id: I7f12d2c69ff70556907ea6f31a0e0bba91b68b49
Closes-Bug: #1469843

commit_message:
Convert list and find to use params parameter

We were doing a last minute switch to params in the page
method, but we need to leave it up to the user to set limit,
marker, fields, and search criteria.  What is supported by the
servers varies a lot.

Closes-Bug: #1466175

Change-Id: I6b5932a812e2d0821f0ae5ed2d93b44dbd10b19a

commit_message:
Allow to load pci_passthrough_whitelist with single quotes

This PciHostDevicesWhiteList uses jsonutils.loads to
load the pci_passthrough_whitelist dict/list. Single quote
is invalid syntax in JSON but it is valid in python dictionary.
This patch allow to read the pci_passthrough_whitelist as python
dict which will allow the support of single quotes.

Change-Id: If0a14bf4d03cd5ca8477ad7c3956a84f0ad94386
Closes-Bug: #1470363

If None is submitted as a MAC address in an allowed_address_pair,
the port MAC will be used. So if two entries are submitted with the
same IP and one's MAC is None while the others is the port's MAC,
they will pass the API duplication check and fail to insert into the DB
due to a unique constraint violation.

This patch catches the db error and turns it into the same exception

"}]
commit_message:
Fix duplicate entry catch for allowed address pairs

If None is submitted as a MAC address in an allowed_address_pair,
the port MAC will be used. So if two entries are submitted with the
same IP and one's MAC is None while the others is the port's MAC,
they will pass the API duplication check and fail to insert into the DB
due to a unique constraint violation.

This patch catches the db error and turns it into the same exception
the API uses on duplicate entries.

Closes-bug: #1373756
Change-Id: Ide995810d6fe0481d3add206bf0674cbbde7f05f

commit_message:
Add CPU frequency to host stats

This change set builds on the prior function and includes a function to
gather the CPU frequency from the system.  This change completes the
functions needed to get the proper CPU Host Stats from within Nova for
the PowerVM hypervisor.

Change-Id: I7a2e9d76d22d3d857b14a9f378e24d6d73423ecc

commit_message:
Fix for mock-1.1.0

This includes 2 classes of fixes (and 1 skip) for mock.

The first is the change in allowed values for assert_has_calls -
https://github.com/testing-cabal/mock/issues/263

The second is a yet unsolved bug around the use of autospec
https://github.com/testing-cabal/mock/issues/264

The skip is because something has changed with mock.open that is
causing the vhduils test to fail. We don't know why, but it's one test
to skip.

This also includes a brute force fix for tox -e docs, because pip is
no longer respecting the sphinx pin in test requirements. This has to
be landed with the other changes because they won't work without it.

commit_message:
Include domain variables in accrc

Include the user and project domain parameters in the generated user rc files.
This is fairly simplistic, if we were to follow the existing attitudes we
should iterate over the domains and add a new level of folders however this
would change the output location for files that may be depended upon.

Change-Id: I5e9e78406b11382751a591d91f711161bb98f47a

commit_message:
Improve hacking rule that checks that [] & {} are used

It is bad to use list() or dict() instead of [] or {}
because it has more symbols and works slower.

Change-Id: I80e1a87c8f18c8dd231be421e065a2f329a3aa91

Whenever a VM moves from one compute node to the other, the VLAN on the old

new switch interface. With this patch, the VLANs are provisioned correctly.

commit_message:
In Arista ML2 driver Reconfigure VLAN on VM migration

Whenever a VM moves from one compute node to the other, the VLAN on the old
switch interface was not removed and the VLAN was not being provisioned on the
new switch interface. With this patch, the VLANs are provisioned correctly.

This patch is a juno port of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/198182/ with
some changes to account for the driver decomposition.

Change-Id: I658ef87ffd82119f41beda9ba019e29a62dc96ff
Closes-Bug: #1471050

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-07-10 22:41:54.000000000', 'files': ['manila/share/drivers/netapp/dataontap/cluster_mode/lib_multi_svm.py', 'manila/share/drivers/netapp/dataontap/client/api.py', 'manila/share/drivers/netapp/dataontap/client/client_base.py', 'manila/tests/share/drivers/netapp/dataontap/client/test_client_cmode.py', 'manila/tests/share/drivers/netapp/dataontap/client/test_client_base.py', 'manila/share/drivers/netapp/dataontap/client/client_cmode.py', 'manila/tests/share/drivers/netapp/dataontap/client/fakes.py', 'manila/tests/share/drivers/netapp/dataontap/cluster_mode/test_lib_multi_svm.py'], 'message': 'Enable Manila multi-SVM driver on NetApp cDOT 8.3

cDOT 8.3 includes numerous new networking features, at least one
of which (broadcast domains) must be used when creating network
interfaces.  This patch enables the multi-SVM driver on cDOT 8.3
by ensuring that each physical port selected to host share server
logical interfaces (LIFs) is a member of a broadcast domain.
A couple of other API tweaks are included that also impeded
operation on cDOT 8.3.

Closes-Bug: #1425754
Change-Id: Ibe92aee217462bce06485e195b930f2fdf43fcc0
'}]
commit_message:
Enable Manila multi-SVM driver on NetApp cDOT 8.3

cDOT 8.3 includes numerous new networking features, at least one
of which (broadcast domains) must be used when creating network
interfaces.  This patch enables the multi-SVM driver on cDOT 8.3
by ensuring that each physical port selected to host share server
logical interfaces (LIFs) is a member of a broadcast domain.
A couple of other API tweaks are included that also impeded
operation on cDOT 8.3.

Closes-Bug: #1425754
Change-Id: Ibe92aee217462bce06485e195b930f2fdf43fcc0

subject: Fix list sorting in command line
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-08 10:36:05.000000000', 'files': ['senlinclient/v1/shell.py'], 'message': 'Fix list sorting in command line

The current support to list sorting from the client side is not
implemented correctly. The sort_keys and sort_dir are not respected by
the print_list method.

This patch fixes this problem by detecting wether sort_keys is set and
behave accordingly.

Change-Id: I802bdc7ca07930742668d3cb52e495fce5ef9159
'}]
commit_message:
Fix list sorting in command line

The current support to list sorting from the client side is not
implemented correctly. The sort_keys and sort_dir are not respected by
the print_list method.

This patch fixes this problem by detecting wether sort_keys is set and
behave accordingly.

Change-Id: I802bdc7ca07930742668d3cb52e495fce5ef9159

subject: Have redis jobboard 'iterjobs'/'wait' funcs return a iterator object
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-07-11 23:00:40.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/jobs/backends/impl_redis.py', 'taskflow/jobs/backends/impl_zookeeper.py'], 'message': "Have redis jobboard 'iterjobs'/'wait' funcs return a iterator object

To make the zookeeper jobboard and redis jobboard iterjobs and wait
functions that much similar have both return iterator objects
with nearly equivalent functions (this makes both of these impls
that much easier to understand and/or read).

At a future time we may just be able to unify both of these iterator
objects to use a common base class.

Change-Id: Ieb0bc8b1ca714d0fa3c737b41df4191d0baa5ad3
"}]
commit_message:
Have redis jobboard 'iterjobs'/'wait' funcs return a iterator object

To make the zookeeper jobboard and redis jobboard iterjobs and wait
functions that much similar have both return iterator objects
with nearly equivalent functions (this makes both of these impls
that much easier to understand and/or read).

At a future time we may just be able to unify both of these iterator
objects to use a common base class.

Change-Id: Ieb0bc8b1ca714d0fa3c737b41df4191d0baa5ad3

Now all objects are comparable.

We need to reset changes, otherwise an object that is constructed and
.create()d is different from the one that is .get_by_id()d from database
(for primitive serialization contains list of changed fields for
versioned objects).

Added initial sql test case for objects (just create-fetch for policy

Change-Id: I012b5fe4e95f166f66da91274734d7184c224dfd

commit_message:
objects.base: reset changes after getting objects from database

Now all objects are comparable.

We need to reset changes, otherwise an object that is constructed and
.create()d is different from the one that is .get_by_id()d from database
(for primitive serialization contains list of changed fields for
versioned objects).

Added initial sql test case for objects (just create-fetch for policy
for now, but can be easily extended to other types).

Change-Id: I012b5fe4e95f166f66da91274734d7184c224dfd

commit_message:
BaseObjectTestCase: rename test_class into _test_class

It seems that testtools are trying to load that class as if it's a test
case (for it considers everything inside a test class named as test_* as
a test case).

Change-Id: Ic4342cc0637d659191f084467ccdb9c90e89a023

subject: Raise VirtualInterfacePlugException
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-12 01:16:07.000000000', 'files': ['nova_powervm/virt/powervm/driver.py', 'nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'Raise VirtualInterfacePlugException

The compute driver method plug_vifs() should raise
VirtualInterfacePlugException when exceptions are enountered.
This is because the compute manager calls plug_vifs() during
start up and it only handles this particular exception. If
other exceptions are raised then the compute manager fails
to start.

One particular case where this can happen is when an instance
is not found on the host.

Change-Id: Iba41727905e7732718f289ea90aa7147b763e232
Closes-Bug: #1473687
'}]
commit_message:
Raise VirtualInterfacePlugException

The compute driver method plug_vifs() should raise
VirtualInterfacePlugException when exceptions are enountered.
This is because the compute manager calls plug_vifs() during
start up and it only handles this particular exception. If
other exceptions are raised then the compute manager fails
to start.

One particular case where this can happen is when an instance
is not found on the host.

Change-Id: Iba41727905e7732718f289ea90aa7147b763e232
Closes-Bug: #1473687

commit_message:
Fix wrong mock method call

There is no assert_called() method in mock, replace it with
assert_called_with() method. The old method used to work with
mock 1.0.1 because it was a noop in magicmock.

Needs https://review.openstack.org/#/c/200583 to pass the requirements check.

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/193935/ changed the OS_* vars
we source by forcing v2password as the auth method.
change our identity v3 test setup by setting v3password

Co-Authored-By: Steve Martinelli <stevemar@ca.ibm.com>

Closes-Bug: 1473454

Depends-on: I0cfab6d13e5d9e744cb302c86a2c21269923e75d

Change-Id: Id22765c7e044797e03d19ad1b103fadec2726aa2

commit_message:
objects.qos: fixed create and update for QosBandwidthLimitRule

To simplify Qos*Rule object type implementation, renamed 'qos_rule_id'
field for qos_bandwidth_limit_rule table into 'id'.

Also added unit test coverage for the object type.

Change-Id: Id6bc992af9f1ab46c022d3c88aa66a0f3bb7f227

subject: Revert "Block installing of mock from wheels"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-12 01:54:25.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/scripts/configure_mirror.sh'], 'message': 'Revert "Block installing of mock from wheels"

This reverts commit 71d10ea626f5a62d6b48133e19f469b19c9a7f14.

It was unnecessary once the offending wheel got removed from PyPI,
and this never worked anyway. It was preventing the ability to boot
new nodes, erroring thusly:

    ./configure_mirror.sh: line 25: /tmp/pip.conf: Permission denied

Deleting the images to which the change was applied returned
nodepool to being able to boot new nodes again.

Change-Id: I0841c6a5a26cf5be22e2d8fea861bdceb0393842
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Block installing of mock from wheels"

This reverts commit 71d10ea626f5a62d6b48133e19f469b19c9a7f14.

It was unnecessary once the offending wheel got removed from PyPI,
and this never worked anyway. It was preventing the ability to boot
new nodes, erroring thusly:

    ./configure_mirror.sh: line 25: /tmp/pip.conf: Permission denied

Deleting the images to which the change was applied returned
nodepool to being able to boot new nodes again.

Change-Id: I0841c6a5a26cf5be22e2d8fea861bdceb0393842

commit_message:
allow innodb_buffer_pool_size to be configurable

innodb_buffer_pool_size is a key parameter in being able to manage mysql
usage of memory. This commits adds a variable to make it configurable,
leaving the default the same, 2G, so as not to affect upgrading
deployments

Fixes-Bug: 1470552
Change-Id: Ia29adfeb6df1a116f5fd65ae5a3c4a838a93a783

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-06-18 09:48:18.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/utils.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_scality.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/scality.py'], 'message': 'Scality SOFS: enhance how the remoteFS mount is detected

Previously we relied on a special "sys" dir being present at the root
of the mount point. This was weak. We now read the mount table and look
for a fuse-based FS mounted at the correct location.

Also, for the unit test, we slowly try to use mock instead of mox.

Change-Id: I055858e66db09fe7c5b1688c9fa05077948f342d
'}]
commit_message:
Scality SOFS: enhance how the remoteFS mount is detected

Previously we relied on a special "sys" dir being present at the root
of the mount point. This was weak. We now read the mount table and look
for a fuse-based FS mounted at the correct location.

Also, for the unit test, we slowly try to use mock instead of mox.

Change-Id: I055858e66db09fe7c5b1688c9fa05077948f342d

commit_message:
Murano API - All Tenants Search

Congress Murano datasource driver pulls environments from one tenant only.
The goal is to pull all environments from all tenants (as nova driver
does for servers).

APIImpact
Change-Id: Idb1917093eecdb892742ff44763a342a2278f60c

commit_message:
[upstream-training] Join OpenStack foundation before contribution

Contributors have to join OpenStack Foundation to push codes to gerrit.
Also, the same email address should be used when signing up for
launchpad, gerrit and the foundation.
New contributors often get stuck on these points.

Closes-Bug: #1470454
Change-Id: I9fc747e8113bf83241e60c45f92c94e49eb8171e

This reverts commit 1b60df85ba3ad442c2e4e7e52538e1b9a1bf9378.

The new version of mock is now released which has the fix to
make mock.patch.stopall behave deterministically. The code to
stop double-mocking is no longer required.

Other fixes:

'assert_has_calls' that have changed behavior in the new version
(no longer accepts single calls).

Calls to non-existent assert methods that did not exist and were
silently passing.

Use of autospec on a class with decorated functions.

Closes-Bug: #1473369
Change-Id: I164a9af2a7f9ac0f0229ec3c5071f7a470445c98
"}]
commit_message:
Fix failures introduced by the new version of mock

This reverts commit 1b60df85ba3ad442c2e4e7e52538e1b9a1bf9378.

The new version of mock is now released which has the fix to
make mock.patch.stopall behave deterministically. The code to
stop double-mocking is no longer required.

Other fixes:

'assert_has_calls' that have changed behavior in the new version
(no longer accepts single calls).

Calls to non-existent assert methods that did not exist and were
silently passing.

Use of autospec on a class with decorated functions.

Closes-Bug: #1473369
Change-Id: I164a9af2a7f9ac0f0229ec3c5071f7a470445c98

commit_message:
Port drbdmanagedrv driver to Python 3

* Replace map() with a list-comprehension where a list is expected
* Replace apply(fn, args) with fn(*args)
* Use str.replace() to remove "{" and "}" characters in _clean_uuid(),
  instead of using str.translate()
* Use literal syntax to create a new dictionary instead of using
  dict() + dict.items()
* tox.ini: add cinder.tests.unit.test_drbdmanagedrv to Python 3.4

Blueprint cinder-python3
Change-Id: I4cb3ae422381442b778de024882e75f31eded5eb

commit_message:
Add LDAP/AD support in Fuel-library

This feature only support pre-existing LDAP/AD with read-only mode currently.
Since keystone team only recommending read-only mode, the others will not be
implemented by this blueprint.
  - configure keystone ldap backend
  - setting account information according to "external_auth" tag in metadata
    from Fuel-web
  - account setting at cluster_ha/cluster_simple

Change-Id: I11fa8813bae3aa8f6e63614292ad4ff236a29fa8
Related-Bug: #1397279
Implements: blueprint fuel-with-existed-ldap

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-01-27 08:23:54.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/init.pp', 'manifests/roles/admin.pp'], 'message': 'handle missing member role _member_

env:
  with read-only ldap auth backend.
error:
  When user creating by puppet-keystone, it create and assign
default role "_member_" to user when user select that tenant as
default tenant. Since user_create will be forbidden by read only
mode, role "_member_" will not be created.
Error will occur when getting user-role map for projects because
horrizon (which using keystone config) still use _member_ as
default user role.
purposes:
create default member role(default to _member_) and writing in
keystone config

Change-Id: Id1cbe69bfc512d93fdafd583e28e6b5ec78d60f4
Closes-Bug: #1414933
'}]
commit_message:
handle missing member role _member_

env:
  with read-only ldap auth backend.
error:
  When user creating by puppet-keystone, it create and assign
default role "_member_" to user when user select that tenant as
default tenant. Since user_create will be forbidden by read only
mode, role "_member_" will not be created.
Error will occur when getting user-role map for projects because
horrizon (which using keystone config) still use _member_ as
default user role.
purposes:
create default member role(default to _member_) and writing in
keystone config

Change-Id: Id1cbe69bfc512d93fdafd583e28e6b5ec78d60f4
Closes-Bug: #1414933

1. Changed exception type from NotFound to specific NotFound
   exception for better readability.
   e.g. VolumeNotFound, SnapshotNotFound etc.

2. Error messages returned to the user are not consistent across
   all apis in case of all exceptions derived from NotFound exception.
   Instead of returning custom error messages return message
   defined in exception class itself.
   NOTE: Doesn't applied to 'HostBinaryNotFound' as host information to
         the tenant should not be leaked.

3. Added explanation to HTTPNotFound wherever appropriate.
   e.g. raise webob.exc.HTTPNotFound() to
        raise webob.exc.HTTPNotFound(explanation=err.msg)

Closes-Bug: #1459958
Change-Id: Ice2c375796fac7533d82125ef97288075fa68b85
"}]
commit_message:
Change generic NotFound to specific exception

1. Changed exception type from NotFound to specific NotFound
   exception for better readability.
   e.g. VolumeNotFound, SnapshotNotFound etc.

2. Error messages returned to the user are not consistent across
   all apis in case of all exceptions derived from NotFound exception.
   Instead of returning custom error messages return message
   defined in exception class itself.
   NOTE: Doesn't applied to 'HostBinaryNotFound' as host information to
         the tenant should not be leaked.

3. Added explanation to HTTPNotFound wherever appropriate.
   e.g. raise webob.exc.HTTPNotFound() to
        raise webob.exc.HTTPNotFound(explanation=err.msg)

Closes-Bug: #1459958
Change-Id: Ice2c375796fac7533d82125ef97288075fa68b85

Whenever a VM moves from one compute node to the other, the VLAN on the old

commit_message:
In Arista ML2 driver Reconfigure VLAN on VM migration

Whenever a VM moves from one compute node to the other, the VLAN on the old
switch interface was not removed and the VLAN was not being provisioned on the
new switch interface. With this patch, the VLANs are provisioned correctly.

This patch is a juno port of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/198182/ with
some changes to account for the driver decomposition.

Change-Id: Icd7f6ea5a4c9341549fa9c926b3ef8a3321936ce
